title: Product Manager (relocation to Abu Dhabi
description: About the job Position: Product Manager Location: Abu Dhabi Presight is an ADX-listed public company with Abu Dhabi based G42 as its majority shareholder and is the region‚Äôs leading big data analytics company powered by GenAI. It combines big data, analytics, and AI expertise to serve every sector, of every scale, to create business and positive societal impact The Opportunity: Looking for an insightful, results-oriented Product Manager to drive the conceptualization, development and rapid testing of analytics products and solutions that will enhance acquisition, engagement and retention of Presight customers. Key Responsibilities: As a Product Manager, you will collaborate with clients and Presight stakeholders to define priorities, deliverables & design approaches, and lead the product strategy, planning, delivery & marketing of Presight solutions & services in line with the overall business objectives and customer requirements. Functional Translate product strategy into detailed requirements for prototype construction and final product development by engineering teams. Prepare detailed requirement specifications, functional specifications, use case, and work- flow diagrams and manage the requirements throughout the project lifecycle. Own the product roadmap and drive the execution of product lifecycle processes, including product research, market research, competitive analysis, planning, positioning, roadmap development, requirements development, and product launch. Monitor progress of product development and own the product backlog to ensure progress is as per the agreed baseline, to achieve timely completion and a return on investment. Measure product performance and mitigate impediments impacting the successful delivery of the product. Familiarity with Figma to facilitate collaboration among various stakeholders. Keeping up to date with AI agents and the latest trending models. Assist the product team by providing expertise/suggestions in the areas of design, storytelling, interaction design, visual design, user research and user behavior. Lead testing efforts in conjunction with the Project and QA Manager, including the design and execution of test scripts and scenarios. Adopt a proactive approach to identify risks and issues, create contingency plans for mitigation, assist with gap analysis and develop proof-of-concepts. Develop product positioning that differentiates Presight and its features across primary market segments. Develop dashboards and reports on product development operations that showcase the performance of the product and usage patterns and suggest possible improvements. Manage all aspects of live products, including customer feedback, requirements and issues. Comply with QHSE (Quality Health Safety and Environment), Business Continuity, Information Security, Privacy, Risk, Compliance Management and Governance of Organizations policies, procedures, plans and related risk assessments. Requirements: Bachelor's Degree in Artificial Intelligence, Business Analytics, Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering or related field. Minimum 8 years of experience in product, software and web design or engineering and development. At least 5 years of experience in analytical product management. Ideally, you‚Äôll also need Domain knowledge across multiple industries. A highly insightful and analytical approach to data. Excellent communication skills. Great presentation and persuasion skills.

title: Product Manager Identity Verification & Fraud
description: About the job The ideal candidate would be able to occasionally visit our Zagreb office, and the role requires working within the CET time zone. While we have a slight preference for candidates based in Zagreb, Croatia, we are also open to applicants from nearby regions and time zones. Our core markets include Bulgaria, Croatia, Romania, and Serbia. Here‚Äôs why this role matters to us At Microblink, we believe that innovation drives success, and our products make a tangible impact by solving some of the most important challenges in the digital landscape. As a Product Manager for BlinkID, you'll help guide the product strategy and shape the future of our AI-powered identity verification solutions. This role is vital in ensuring our products meet the evolving needs of our customers, and by leading the development process, you will help maintain BlinkID's leadership in the industry. A little bit about us Microblink is an AI company specializing in computer vision, dedicated to building innovative products and tools that help create a secure, fraud-free digital identity landscape. With headquarters in New York and Zagreb, our teams across the U.S. and Europe impact hundreds of millions of people each year, processing over 800 million identity documents across more than 70 countries. Here‚Äôs what you‚Äôll do Define, develop, and execute the product strategy and roadmap for our products BlinkID Verify and BlinkCard Conduct market research to identify emerging opportunities and trends in identity verification technology Work closely with cross-functional teams, including engineering and design, to ensure seamless product development Collaborate with customers and stakeholders to gather feedback and validate product direction Monitor product performance using key metrics and KPIs, making data-driven decisions for optimization Ensure high-quality product delivery, from ideation to launch and iterative improvements Engage with the marketing and sales teams to develop go-to-market strategies and product marketing materials Provide ongoing support to ensure customers derive maximum value from BlinkID Verify and BlinkCard products You'll be successful in this role if you Have proven experience in product management roles, ideally within the identity verification, document scanning, or related technology sectors (Fintech, Payments, Security) for 3-5 product cycles minimum Possess a strong understanding of Agile methodologies and the software development process Have solid experience with SDK/API-based products and their integrations Have relevant and demonstrated experience with technologies like computer vision, OCR, machine learning, and data analysis Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills Demonstrate strong analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making abilities Have a customer-focused mindset and strategic thinking to drive product success Excellent GTM product skills Qualifications Education in Computer Science, Engineering, Business, or a relevant field Proven experience in product management, preferably in the identity verification, fraud or technology space Familiarity with mobile and web development platforms, such as iOS, Android, and web frameworks Strong leadership qualities with the ability to collaborate across diverse teams Here‚Äôs what you‚Äôll gain if you join us Equity participation for all full-time employees, fostering shared success Unlimited PTO, giving you the flexibility to take time off as needed to maintain a healthy work-life balance Location-specific benefits tailored to personal preferences and regional needs. Flexible work arrangements, including remote work options and the opportunity to work at our Zagreb office Access to internal L&D programs to enhance your skills in a supportive environment How can you join us? If this role intrigues you, do not hesitate to hit the apply button and send us your resume. We are excited to meet talents around the world.

title: Product Manager
description: About the job Position Title: Product Insight Manager Location: Remote ‚Äì Open to candidates across the EU Reporting to: European General Manager (based in Hungary) Client: Fast-growing MRO company, publicly listed on NASDAQ About the Company Our client is a dynamic and rapidly expanding MRO (Maintenance, Repair & Operations) solutions provider, publicly listed on the NASDAQ. With a strong global presence and significant market share in Asia, the company is now in an accelerated growth phase in Europe, offering innovative procurement and supply chain solutions to industrial clients. Role Overview As Product Insight Manager, you will play a critical role in shaping the company‚Äôs European product strategy. You will analyze market trends, customer needs, and competitive offerings to ensure the European product portfolio aligns with both local market demands and the company‚Äôs global strategy. This role is fully remote, offering flexibility while collaborating closely with the European General Manager and cross-functional teams. Key Responsibilities Conduct in-depth market and competitor analysis to identify emerging trends, pricing dynamics, and product gaps in the European MRO market. Gather, interpret, and present actionable product insights to support business development, category management, and marketing teams. Work closely with the European GM to develop product strategies and roadmap tailored to the EU market. Collaborate with global product and sourcing teams to align local market needs with global supply capabilities. Support product lifecycle management, from introduction to phase-out, ensuring profitability and customer satisfaction. Monitor and evaluate product performance metrics and recommend adjustments as needed. Build strong relationships with key stakeholders, suppliers, and partners to improve product offering and market positioning. Qualifications & Experience Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business, Marketing, Engineering, or related field (Master‚Äôs degree preferred). Minimum 5 years of experience in product management, product insight, or category management ‚Äî preferably in the MRO, industrial supply, or related sectors. Direct industry experience strongly preferred ‚Äî for example, in handling tools, industrial equipment, or related product categories. Strong analytical skills with proven ability to turn data into actionable insights. Excellent understanding of European industrial markets and customer needs. Experience working in cross-cultural, global organizations. Proficient in English; additional European languages are an advantage. Strong communication, presentation, and stakeholder management skills. Additional Information Work Arrangement: 100% remote within the EU, occasional travel for team meetings or supplier visits. Reporting Line: Directly to the European General Manager, based in Hungary. Impact: Opportunity to shape the product strategy for a rapidly expanding European market within a high-growth, publicly listed company.

title: Principal Product Manager
description: About the job üöÄ Who Are We? Welcome to Welltech‚Äîwhere health meets innovation! üåç As a global leader in Health & Fitness industry, we‚Äôve crossed over 200 million installs with five life-changing apps, all designed to boost well-being for millions. Our mission? To transform lives through intuitive nutrition trackers, powerful fitness solutions, and personalized wellness journeys‚Äîall powered by a diverse team of over 700 passionate professionals with presence across 5 hubs. Why Welltech? Imagine joining a team where your impact on global health and wellness is felt daily. At Welltech, we strive to be proactive wellness partners for our users, while continually evolving ourselves. What We're Looking For We are seeking a dynamic and results-oriented Product Manager to join our team. In this pivotal role, you will drive the product vision, strategy, and execution, leading one of our 3 product squads, ensuring delivery of exceptional value to our new users. This involves understanding user needs, defining product requirements, and collaborating with cross-functional teams to bring innovative features to market. Key Responsibilities: Product Strategy & Roadmap Create and maintain the product roadmap for your squad, aligning it with business objectives and user needs. Conduct market research and competitive analysis to identify opportunities for product innovation. Define and prioritize product hypotheses based on data-driven insights and user feedback. Product Execution Collaborate closely with engineering, design, and marketing teams to deliver high-quality product features. Manage the product lifecycle from concept to launch, ensuring timely and effective execution. Utilize Agile methodologies (Scrum) to manage product development and iterate on features. You will work closely with Engineering Manager to lead squad delivery together. User Focus & Data Analysis Conduct user research and gather feedback to understand user needs and pain points. Analyze product data and user behavior to identify trends and opportunities for improvement. Run a looot of A/B tests to optimize product features and enhance user experience. Base all product decisions on data. Collaboration & Communication Communicate product vision and strategy to stakeholders across the organization. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure alignment and effective execution. Actively engage with product communities to bring external insights into the product. Driving Long-Term Usage Retention & LTV Growth Focus on creating and optimizing value for our subscription-based users. Test and discover new ways to improve user experience. Candidate journey ‚≠ïÔ∏è Recruiter call --> ‚≠ïÔ∏è Meet a team member --> ‚≠ïÔ∏è Skills assessment--> ‚≠ïÔ∏è Meet the Leadership team ‚ú® Why You‚Äôll Love Being Part of Welltech: Grow Together: Join a culture that champions both personal and professional growth. Here, you‚Äôll thrive as we learn, evolve, and succeed together. Lead by Example: No matter your role, your leadership matters. Every team member is empowered to inspire and make an impact. Results-Driven: We‚Äôre all about achieving meaningful outcomes. It‚Äôs not just about the effort, but the difference we make every day. We Are Well-Makers: Be part of a movement that‚Äôs creating a healthier, happier world. Together, we make well-being a reality! Check out some of our products Muscle Booster ‚Äî https://musclebooster.fitness/ Yoga-Go ‚Äî https://yoga-go.io/ WalkFit - http://walkfit.pro

title: Staff Product Manager (remote, UTC-3 to UTC+3)
description: About the job (Fully remote, async-first, DevTool SaaS, 32-40h/week, time zones: UTC-3 to UTC+3) Location: This is a FULLY remote role, but you must be within UTC-3 to UTC+3 to work with your team, peers, and internal customers. You do not have to be in the specific country or city shown in this listing, but please only apply if you are physically based within the UTC-3 to UTC+3 timezone. -- Join Checkly as a Staff Product Manager and empower developers to own and ensure application performance and reliability - from pull request to post-mortem! Checkly helps engineers build reliable products by unifying testing, monitoring and observability. OpenTelemetry, Playwright, and Monitoring as Code are our foundation for unifying performance and reliability. Our tech stack is Vue.js, Node.js, TypeScript, Postgres, ClickHouse and AWS. We ship to prod all day, every day. We practice Agile (not scrum) and take pride in good documentation and good looking products. We‚Äôre a remote-first startup that keeps things simple‚Äîlow on meetings, high on productivity, and always shipping. If you love building cool things, working async, actually listening to and working with customers, and keeping it lean, you‚Äôll fit right in! Thousands of developers‚Äîteams at 1Password, CrowdStrike, Render, LinkedIn and Vercel included‚Äîtrust Checkly to keep their apps running smoothly. In 2024, we raised $20M in Series B funding from Balderton, CRV, and Accel to take things to the next level. We care about building a team where people of all backgrounds are encouraged to do their best work. To achieve this we built a flexible, remote-first and async-first startup environment with inclusive benefits and full transparency about how we pay. What You'll Do As a Staff Product Manager, you will be responsible for empowering developers and designers to solve customer problems. You will report to our CPO, Alberto Gomez. You will: Learn all about the monitoring and observability market, figuring out its strengths and weaknesses to take our products to a new level. Use your empathy for the daily challenges of DevOps, SRE and (Platform) Engineering teams to create solutions to their problems. Understand the dynamics of the testing, monitoring, and observability market, and use that knowledge to bring Checkly and our growing customer base to the next level. Focus on making an impact while also being mindful about speed, efficiency and cost. Lead initiatives that span multiple teams, aligning stakeholders across Product, Engineering, Design, Sales and Marketing. Represent Checkly externally in key customer relationships and developer communities. What You Should Have Experience as a Product Manager, working on a technical product, preferably solving problems for engineers. Prior experience in the monitoring or observability space is a very big plus. You "get" developers ‚Äî our main customers ‚Äî through your engineering background. Self-motivated, highly driven, and eager to try to do things differently. You value autonomy, and believe in empowered teams to solve customer problems in a remote work environment Very hands-on, you use your coding abilities and AI tooling to understand customers and market dynamics, create mock designs, design system components, assessing technical viability, and writing micro-copy You have shipped multiple product features to developers, from concept to delivery. You can ship "big bang", but also manage early access, beta and staged rollouts using feature flags. You reduce risk by testing the market, and trying things out with a small groups of users. Proven ability to work cross-functionally, collaborate, influence and work as part of a team Excellent spoken and written English skills are a must. Ability to be autonomous and self-motivated in a remote work environment, while you also enjoy getting to know your colleagues and helping others. FULLY remote role, within the UTC-3 to UTC+3 time zones. Why us? Transparent salary because your salary shouldn't be dictated by how good a negotiator you are. (more info below) Remote-first, flexible work hours, async-first (low meeting, high productivity) and transparent culture Use the latest technologies and innovate with us: we are THE Monitoring-as-Code company Become part of a fast-growing, international, and remote team where your work matters‚Äîyour impact won‚Äôt get lost in layers of bureaucracy. Stock options 27 days of paid vacation + your local public holidays Paid sick leave & up to 14 weeks of paid parental leave $1,500 learning, visiting and wellness budget Co-working budget or home office setup Bi-annual company retreats Employee & contractor options Find out more here. What We Pay Fair, competitive, and transparent pay is very important for us. Therefore we work with a standardized salary calculator that includes several factors such as seniority level as well as location. For this role, the range is ‚Ç¨119k - ‚Ç¨133k for someone in a similar cost of market as UK, Germany etc, + stock options ‚Ç¨107k - ‚Ç¨119k for someone in a similar cost of market as Spain, Poland, Ukraine etc, + stock options Apply If this sounds interesting, please apply! Studies by several different sources have shown that on average men will apply for a job if they meet 60% of the application requirements. Women,non-binary people and POC will seek to match a much higher percentage of requirements before applying. If you're not sure you're the right fit, apply anyway and let us know what you bring to the table. We'd love to hear from you! We're all about being transparent and setting clear expectations. That's why we've put together our hiring playbook and open-sourced our employee handbook. There you'll find a sneak peek of who we are, how we work and what you can expect in our hiring process. Compensation Range: ‚Ç¨119K - ‚Ç¨133K

title: Sales Account & Product Manager Iberia ‚Äì Compounding / Plastic Materials
description: About the job IMCD (www.imcdgroup.com) es una empresa multinacional l√≠der en la distribuci√≥n de especialidades qu√≠micas para diferentes sectores (plastic, pharma, personal care, food, industry, etc.). Actualmente est√° buscando a un/a: Sales Account & Product Manager Iberia ‚Äì Compounding / Plastic Materials Reportando al Business Unit Manager Advanced Materials Iberia, y con una clara orientaci√≥n a la venta de soluciones t√©cnicas, se responsabilizar√° de la captaci√≥n y desarrollo de potenciales clientes en el sector del compounding, masterbatch, plastic recycling cubriendo la zona de actuaci√≥n comercial de todo Iberia. Con una doble funci√≥n como Sales Account Manager y Product Manager, tendr√° asignadas algunas de nuestras representadas (firmas de primer nivel en la fabricaci√≥n de materiales pl√°sticos), y tendr√° que participar en la implantaci√≥n de planes de acci√≥n, as√≠ como asegurar la correcta rotaci√≥n del stock y la elaboraci√≥n de propuestas de compras. Pensamos en una persona con experiencia comercial t√©cnica en el mercado de los pol√≠meros y aditivos pl√°sticos, con una formaci√≥n superior preferiblemente en qu√≠mica o ingenier√≠a. Es necesario disponer de un buen nivel de ingl√©s y disponibilidad para viajar. Se valorar√° positivamente experiencia con Sales Force. Ofrecemos la oportunidad de incorporaci√≥n a un proyecto estimulante, en una s√≥lida multinacional l√≠der en su sector, que ofrece posibilidades de crecimiento y desarrollo profesional.

title: Product Manager
description: About the job An international health & beauty business with strong roots in Asia and a growing footprint in Europe is looking for a Medical Device Marketing Manager to drive the development and launch of cutting-edge skin booster and skincare solutions across the EMEA region. You will be joining a nimble, entrepreneurial team with the backing of a major global healthcare group. This is a unique opportunity to shape a medical device portfolio from the ground up, working closely with strategic CDMO partners and medical advisors to build a disruptive aesthetic business. Key responsibilities: Lead market analysis and go-to-market strategy for innovative aesthetic medical devices. Manage the launch and lifecycle of skin boosters and other medical device solutions via partnerships. Drive new product development in collaboration with medical advisors and manufacturing partners. Oversee regulatory affairs in partnership with external consultants. Build relationships with KOL doctors and develop impactful promotional and event strategies. Play a key role in strategic alliances and acquisition projects related to medical aesthetics. Take full ownership of P&L for the medical device business line. To be considered for the role, you must closely match the following criteria: Proven track record in the aesthetic medical device industry (skin boosters, dermal fillers would be preferred) Experience working in Product Management positions with proven success working with product pipeline from early stage through to launch. You are confident leading projects independently, comfortable operating in fast-moving and entrepreneurial environments, and experienced in working with doctors and scientific advisors. You combine strategic thinking with executional focus and bring a deep understanding of regulatory and commercial realities in the medical device space.

title: Global Product Manager Ruminants
description: About the job Global Product Management ‚Äì Ruminants Market Strategy and Portfolio Management (Leading Products) Objective: Serve as the primary point of contact for operations, distributors, sales, innovation, and communication supporting Cross-Functional Collaboration. Lead product portfolio and market strategy including product lifecycle management of Leading Products based on market needs and opportunities. Drive global market development for Leading Products, steer product launch and re-launch ensuring alignment with overall business goals. Support sales in defining the optimal channel management strategy Based on business goals consolidate sales budget across all markets defining and tracking key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure product success Key Responsibilities: 1. Cross-Functional Collaboration Work closely with Innovation group to ensure that new products align with market needs and customer demands. Steer launch of new products locally with sales organization by bridging technical knowledge with commercial strategies Align with market communication teams to create compelling sales materials and campaigns. Coordinate with production ensuring product availability for all focus markets 2. Market Potential Analysis Conduct market research to identify customer needs, market trends, competitive landscape, and growth opportunities in key markets Translate insights into actionable recommendations to inform product strategies. Support activity capturing market opportunities as they appear 3. Strategic Portfolio Development Define the long-term vision and roadmap for products in the portfolio. Highlight portfolio gabs and deliver new ideas to innovation supporting the development of holistic portfolio focusing on solutions aligned with the company's strategic goals. Support the development of tailored customer solutions and product positioning. 4. Launch Planning and Execution Lead launch strategies, ensuring alignment across product development, marketing, sales, and operational teams. Ensure compliance with regulatory requirements and supply chain readiness before launch Develop go-to-market plans, oversee execution, and monitor the success of product launches. Drive promotional activities, and customer communication, in collaboration with local teams and regional managers 5. Sales Support & Commercial Guidance Develop and implement pricing strategies that maximize market share and profitability. Conduct pricing analysis, monitor competitive pricing, and adjust strategies as needed. Provide strategic and technical support to sales regional managers. Support the development of sales tools, sales training materials, and value propositions to enhance commercial success. 6. Performance Monitoring and Optimization Track key performance metrics to measure product success and identify areas for improvement. Continuously optimize the product lifecycle through data-driven decision- making and feedback loops. Key Metrics for Success: Profitable Sales growth and market share expansion. Customer satisfaction and engagement levels. Successful execution of launch initiatives. Effective cross-functional collaboration. Education and Experience: Bachelor's or Master's Degree in Ruminant Nutrition and preferably a degree in Marketing, Business, Communications, or a related field Several years of experience in marketing specialty products, with a focus on strategic planning and execution Skills: Strong analytical skills to interpret market data and trends Excellent English communication skills, both verbally and in writing Ability to work internationally and collaborate with cross-functional teams in a matrix organization Willing to travel 60-100 days annually Project management skills to oversee marketing campaigns and launch initiatives Location: EU remote-based

title: Product Manager - Specialty tyres
description: About the job Who We Are: Sailun Group (https://en.sailungroup.com/) is one of the world's leading rubber technology and tyre companies. Being the 10th largest manufacturer in the world, Sailun Group is offering a broad portfolio of passenger car, truck and bus as well as specialty tyres. The brand Sailun is the fastest growing tyre brand globally (2023) and among the Top Ten in sustainability perception. Smart manufacturing ensuring superior product quality, emotional brand building and passionate people are the key drivers for Sailun‚Äôs success story today and in the future. Sailun Group‚Äôs products are available in more than 180 markets and regions in the Americas, Europe, Asia and Africa. With over 18,000 dedicated talents, we are heading to extend our operating footprints in the major markets to best serve the local customer needs, and aspiring to become the leader of the local market. Position Overview: As a Product Manager - Specialty tyres at Sailun Group, you will play a crucial role in the lifecycle of our specialty tyre products, from initial feasibility analysis to market release and performance evaluation. Your expertise will help ensure that our products meet market demands and maintain a competitive edge. The ideal candidate will possess a strong technical background, excellent analytical skills, and the ability to collaborate across various departments. Key Responsibilities: Market Analysis and Feasibility Reporting: Conduct comprehensive feasibility analyses for new product development, assessing market demand and potential. Prepare detailed reports on market trends and future product opportunities. Quality Supervision and Feedback Management: Monitor and analyze product performance in the market. Address and resolve feedback and issues related to product quality and market usage. Technical Specifications and Market Promotion: Develop and release technical specifications and standards for new products. Plan and execute information release and market promotion strategies for new products. Technical Management of Test Tyres: Oversee the technical aspects of test tyres within the company. Ensure testing protocols and standards are adhered to and analyzed for product improvement. Industry Information and Research Development: Gather and analyze the latest industry information to guide future research and development. Identify trends and opportunities in the replacement tyre market. Competitive Analysis and Performance Comparison: Collect and analyze data on industry competitors. Develop and implement performance comparison plans between our products and competitors. Provide detailed analysis and reports to maintain our competitive advantage. Budget Preparation and Financial Oversight: Contribute to the preparation of the annual product research and development budget. Monitor and control budget expenditures to ensure financial efficiency. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Business, Engineering, or a related field; Master's degree preferred. Proven experience as a Specialty Product Manager in the tyre industry. Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret market data and trends. Excellent project management and organizational skills. Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams. Strong communication and presentation skills. Proficiency in relevant software and tools for product management and market analysis. What We Can Offer: A platform to raise your innovative ideas and bring them into realization, make your mark in the tyre industry and beyond; Being part of a rapidly growing company which strives for further success worldwide; Being immersed in a people-oriented culture built on trust and respect; Being part of a diverse, fun, high-spirited and empowered team and interacting with counterparts from other regions internationally and colleagues from varied disciplines; A commitment to train and develop you continuously throughout your career; A career path that allows you to demonstrate your full potential; Competitive compensation and benefits package and non-financial recognition to reward your dedication and achievements.

title: Product Manager
description: About the job About MEDDICC We‚Äôre a high-performing team brought together by the ambition to build something extraordinary. MEDDICC is a proven B2B sales framework, and trusted by the world‚Äôs top tech companies for over 25 years. What began as a learning and enablement business - founded by Andy Whyte, best-selling author of MEDDICC: The ultimate guide to staying one step ahead in the complex sale - is now evolving into a next-generation sales enablement platform. 2025 will be about building the operating system for modern sales teams‚Äîanchored around Adaptive Enablement, Applied Execution, and Actionable Insights. We‚Äôre profitable, bootstrapped, growing over 30% year-on-year, and we are looking for exceptional A-Players to help bring our vision to life. We are looking for We're looking for a Product Manager who thrives in a high-trust, collaborative environment, someone who takes initiative, seeks clarity, and is driven by the impact of their work. In this role, you‚Äôll take ownership of a key product area from discovery through delivery. You‚Äôll work closely with Sales and customers to uncover pain points, partner with Design and Engineering to shape thoughtful solutions, and help the team deliver with focus and speed. You‚Äôll be responsible for defining and executing a clear roadmap, tracking success through measurable outcomes, and helping the wider organization understand how your work is shaping customer behavior and business results. This is a great opportunity for someone who loves solving problems, thrives on cross-functional collaboration, and enjoys working autonomously toward ambitious goals. What You'll Do Own your product area: Define a quarterly roadmap based on insight and strategy. Prioritize work that aligns to real customer needs and clear business goals. Ship with urgency and focus on what matters. Lead discovery with Sales and customers: Actively engage with Sales and users to uncover pain points and validate what‚Äôs worth solving. You challenge assumptions and stay grounded in customer reality. Use data to guide decisions: Define success metrics upfront. Track performance, measure outcomes, and use both quantitative and qualitative signals to continuously improve. Partner across disciplines: Work hand-in-hand with Design to shape solutions that are intuitive and effective. Partner with Engineering to deliver value quickly, iteratively, and with quality. Lead a high-performing Scrum team: Run all agile ceremonies (planning, standups, retros) and help your team stay aligned, focused, and moving fast. You remove blockers and raise the bar. Communicate and influence: Articulate the ‚Äúwhy‚Äù behind your roadmap. Defend trade-offs, align stakeholders, and educate the org on the impact of what‚Äôs been shipped. Qualifications 4+ years of product management experience Skilled in discovery, user research, and engaging with Sales to find signal Strong grasp of agile product development and running high-velocity teams Experience building and owning a roadmap that drives measurable outcomes Data-driven mindset: you define success, track it, and act on what you learn Excellent communicator and collaborator across disciplines Additional Information This role will report to the Chief Product Officer (laura@medddicc.com) This roles is fully remote but may require occasional travel to our studio in Cambridgeshire or Barcelona Candidate process: CV Screening > First Case Interview > Second Case Interview > Cultural Fit (C8) & References

title: Junior Product Manager
description: About the job Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1200+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution. The company is founder led, profitable and growing. Canonical‚Äôs product management team are technologists who have a passion for delivering products and solutions that help shape market demands while elevating open source software everywhere. This is a general application track for the product management positions at Canonical. You will set a clear vision, prioritize work effectively, and ensure the team delivers high-quality products that meet business and user needs. Apply here if you excel at leadership, communication, and technical vision, and believe you can drive product strategy for the business needs of tomorrow. During the interview process we will identify specific software products which would be a good fit for your interests. We believe that open source is transforming the way that enterprises solve their business needs. Although open source has been around for thirty years, it is only now fundamental to every corner of the software landscape. Going forward we believe open source will have an even bigger impact as it moves into specialised vertical markets. Our goal is to make open source easier, more reliable and more secure for deployment and development. We strive to be the provider of ‚Äòmost software to most companies‚Äô, starting with Ubuntu but expanding to cover every class of application on every class of compute. To deliver on that ambition, we select product managers for their intellect and strong drive to advance the open source community. Together, we aim to improve open source quality, outreach, and impact. Our product managers set the vision and the direction to ensure teams deliver the right products in the right markets at the right time. They push the boundaries of the technology landscape to identify and deliver products into new and existing market opportunities. Our product managers are technology professionals with a software engineering background who strive to become business executives and entrepreneurs. We discuss strategy, plan product development, drive engagement, and promote the open source way. We oversee the entire product lifecycle from conception to delivery, blending technical expertise, strategic thinking, analytics, project management skills and effective communication to ensure products meet both user needs and business objectives. We have open product manager roles across a wide range of product domains, including: Ubuntu Platform - Our Ubuntu experience on Desktop, Server, Windows (WSL), Multipass, Gaming, Enterprise, & Hardware Enablement Ubuntu Pro Services - Our key commercial offerings Ubuntu Pro, Compliance, Standards, Security Engineering, and Managed Services on cloud and on prem AI/ML & MLOps - Open source AI/ML solutions, AIOps automation, model lifecycle management, Kubeflow, MLFlow, KServe, and AI infrastructure on cloud and edge IoT - Ubuntu on embedded devices and/or edge servers, device management, and robotics Cloud - Ubuntu in public and private clouds, promoting automation frameworks, and including technologies such as Kubernetes, MAAS, and LXD Telco - Open source for Telco's including technologies and standards related to Core Network, RAN/vRAN, SoNIC, DENT, and SmartNICs Finance - Open source solutions for financial institutions including trading platforms, blockchain technologies, regulatory compliance, and AI-driven analytics Automotive - Open source solutions for autonomous driving, in-vehicle infotainment, connected vehicles, and compliance with automotive industry standards such as ISO 26262 and ISO 21434 Application Management - Open source solutions in the enterprise including Observability, IAM, App Stores and technologies such Grafana, GitOps, and Juju Charms If your domain of expertise isn‚Äôt listed above, yet you feel it‚Äôs relevant to Canonical, then feel free to apply anyway. We will route you to the most suitable team. Location: These roles are home based in the EMEA time zone. You will be expected to be located in this region. The role entails Lead the product development lifecycle, reviewing the priorities and goals for your product Collaborate with cross-functional teams such as engineering, design, marketing, and sales Address common challenges across projects, align on priorities, enable informed decisions, and keep business execution on track Conduct market research, analyse industry trends, and gather customer feedback to identify opportunities Communicate your product vision, status updates, and key decisions to ensure alignment and manage expectations Conduct usability testing, analyse user feedback, and iterate on the product to improve the user experience Collaborate with marketing, sales, and support teams to develop go-to-market strategies, create product documentation, and provide training Contribute to the success of our sales team in winning new opportunities, reviewing customer feedback and participating in customer meetings Oversee the work of a product line, ensuring consistency in strategy and execution across different teams Facilitate collaboration and resolve conflicts within different teams and across other departments What we are looking for in you Exceptional academic results at high school and university Understanding of Linux and the wider open source software community Understanding of computer architecture, application development, datacenters, cloud or devices Passion to write about technologies and the tech landscape A strong work ethic, and personal interests aligned with the open source movement Curiosity, and the habit of continuous learning A strong sense of ownership Problem solving and the ability to innovate Outstanding communications skills in English, both verbal and written Ability to manage multiple projects or product lines while maintaining focus on key priorities Willingness to travel internationally up to 4 times a year for company events up to two weeks long Additional Skills That We Value Familiarity with a particular verticals (e.g. Telco, Finance, Industrial, Automotive) Familiarity with the technology ecosystem including Silicon, IHV, ISV, ODM/OEMs, cloud service providers and channel Familiarity with cloud native technologies such as Kubernetes, Docker containers & Snaps Familiarity with embedded and connected device technology and ecosystems Familiarity with networking technologies - ethernet, IPv4 and IPv6, routing, firewalling, overlays such as OVN/OVS, VPNs, SR-IOV, infiniband Familiarity with telco networking - RAN, Core, CPE Experience in leading distributed teams across different time zones Demonstrated ability to foster collaboration and innovation in team settings What we offer you We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally. Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year Annual compensation review Recognition rewards Annual holiday leave Maternity and paternity leave Employee Assistance Program Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events About Canonical Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical is an equal opportunity employer We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.
