title: Ventures Analyst
description: About the job WHO WE ARE: Plug and Play Tech Center is the largest global innovation platform and one of Silicon Valley‚Äôs most active early stage investors. We bring together the best start-ups and the world's largest corporations to create meaningful connections that help top companies innovate and meet their strategic goals. We are on a mission to bring the benefits of startup-focused open innovation to all four corners of the world. Plug and Play has over 60 locations across the world and our corporate members include: The Alliance to End Plastic Waste, USAA, Visa, Nationwide, Aflac, Daimler, Ford, Nissan, BP, Johnson & Johnson, Roche, Pfizer, Walmart, Coca Cola, Adidas, and over 500 more. Plug and Play‚Äôs corporate members utilize Plug and Play to identify the best startups to meet their challenges. Plug and Play‚Äôs proven investment track record includes Honey, Guardant Health, Owkin, Zama, BigID, Kustomer, Rappi, Flutterwave, Hippo, PayPal, Lending Club, Dropbox, and many more. WHO WE‚ÄôRE LOOKING FOR: We‚Äôre an exceptional team with backgrounds in technology and entrepreneurship and we‚Äôre growing rapidly to deliver on our mission. We‚Äôre actively seeking a Ventures Analyst in Valencia to champion the Plug and Play business model and drive portfolio growth. HOW YOU WILL MAKE A DIFFERENCE?: Startup Sourcing & Pipeline Development Identify and source high-potential startups across the Paris-managed industries. Attend calls and meetings with startups to assess solutions, scalability, and relevance for corporate partners. Maintain a high-quality, up-to-date dealflow pipeline for multiple industry verticals. Ecosystem & Relationship Building Build and nurture relationships with VCs, accelerators, universities, corporations, and other ecosystem players in France and internationally. Actively network with startup founders at industry events, meetups, and conferences to uncover new opportunities. Maintain strong and lasting relationships with industry partners to enable strategic introductions. Corporate Partner Engagement Schedule and facilitate dealflow meetings between startups and corporate partners. Curate custom startup lists tailored to each partner‚Äôs technology interests and strategic objectives. Track and report engagement KPIs such as startup introductions, pilots launched, and partnerships signed. Investment Support & Due Diligence Support senior Ventures team members on investment opportunities from sourcing to closing. Conduct due diligence on target startups, including market research, competitive analysis, business model review, and cap table assessment. Contribute to investment recommendation memos and present findings to the Ventures team. Assist portfolio companies post-investment through partner introductions and market access initiatives. REQUIRED EXPERIENCE: Education: Master‚Äôs degree in Engineering, Business, Economics, or a related field from Tier 1 Schools. Experience: Previous exposure to startups, venture capital, innovation consulting, or one of the target industries is a plus. Passion for emerging technologies Understanding of startup financing, venture capital, and growth metrics. Strong networking and relationship-building abilities across diverse stakeholders. Excellent communication skills with the ability to engage C-suite executives and VC partners. Strategic, analytical, and creative problem-solving mindset. Professional English proficiency required; French and/or German is a plus. WHAT WE OFFER: Be part of Plug and Play - the biggest and fastest-growing startup innovation platform globally with locations worldwide Be at the forefront of innovation and get access to groundbreaking technologies Build a strong global network of startups, VCs, and corporate leaders. Have real autonomy to source, evaluate, and support startups in building your own portfolio. Work in a dynamic, international team with a vibrant and open culture. Grow your career with mentorship, exposure, and global opportunities. Contribute your own ideas and take ownership of impactful projects.

title: ERP Business Analyst (Valencia or Amsterdam)
description: About the job We offer an opportunity you simply won‚Äôt find anywhere else. In less than five years, Mileway has grown into Europe‚Äôs leader in last mile logistics real estate, with a 550-plus team across twenty six offices in eleven countries. We‚Äôre looking for a proactive and driven IT Business Analyst to provide support and operational assistance for our ERP environment. The right candidate will be a natural problem solver and a great collaborator, eager to share their exceptional knowledge and helpful attitude. You‚Äôll be part of a dynamic team, working alongside colleagues from all over Europe. You will work with property managers, finance and accounting and asset management teams to help us get the most out of the application Basware and Yardi. You‚Äôll make sure the best standards are upheld, provide support and training, and implement Mileway‚Äôs policies and procedures. You‚Äôll be working side by side with the Product Owner, analyzing (complex) requirements from the business partners, finding solutions and implementing these solutions. Candidates based in Valencia or Amsterdam are welcome to apply; please note that relocation assistance is not available for this position. Working at Mileway We offer an opportunity you simply won‚Äôt find anywhere else. Launched in 2019, Mileway has rapidly grown into Europe‚Äôs leader in last-mile logistics real estate, with a team of over 550 across more than twenty offices in 11 countries. From the start, Mileway set out to be a different kind of real estate company, with a cloud-based IT infrastructure and a team that combines local expertise with the pooled strengths of a pan-European presence. Our culture is fast-paced and highly international, with team members from more than 50 countries, bringing diverse perspectives and a ‚Äúcan-do‚Äù attitude to everything we do. While we have already achieved a lot, we‚Äôre only just getting started ‚Äì our purpose is to be the most customer- and climate-focused last-mile real estate company in Europe, creating space for businesses to grow sustainably. To get there, we live by our values: Drive, Trust, Grow, Together. At Mileway, we believe company growth comes from supporting the growth of our combined capabilities. That‚Äôs why we offer an in-house learning & development program where personal, professional, and business development go hand in hand, helping you carve out your own unique career path. You‚Äôll be based at our Valencia or Amsterdam office. While we embrace a flexible approach to work, our policy requires working from the office three days a week. To support this, we provide a state-of-the-art technology package to keep you connected at all times. What you‚Äôll do Collaborate with stakeholders from Finance, Procurement, Treasury and Construction Management. Prioritise, refine, and split user stories in Jira, remove impediments, and guarantee each story meets the Definition of Ready/Done. Run elicitation sessions, capture business rules, model processes/data, and produce clear acceptance criteria that mirror stakeholder expectations. Provide day-to-day answers on requirements and business rules, coordinating smoothly between stakeholders and the Scrum team. Maintain a living traceability matrix, map dependencies, and perform impact assessments whenever scope or design changes. What you‚Äôll bring At least 3-5 years of experience working with ERP process areas (P2P, O2C, R2R). A bachelor‚Äôs degree or equivalent experience in Business Administration, Information Systems, Engineering, or a related field / related experience. Experience working with Finance, Treasury, Procurement and/or Construction Management in prior companies. Knowledge of Real Estate. We would prefer that you are fluent in the terminology and principles used in this field. Excellent communication skills. You are fluent in business English, both written and spoken, and able to produce polished, professional presentations, emails, and training materials. An exceptional team attitude. You are able to work well independently, but you‚Äôre also a people person and recognize that collaboration is key. We can count on you for a professional, pragmatic, and solution-oriented approach. Your ability to manage a fast-moving environment and shifting responsibilities. You are flexible and able to manage your time against changing priorities You are a natural problem solver with strong analytical skills. Our vision is to be the number one gateway to urban communities. To get there, we live our values: Drive, Trust, Grow, Together.

title: Junior Portfolio Analyst
description: About the job FundRock is a Pan-European leading independent UCITS management company and AIFM (Alternative Investment Fund Manager). Our clients are established blue-chip companies and leaders in their domestic market. We invest in our people, enabling you to develop your skills and build on your experience. If you like the idea of working for an ambitious and growing company, as part of a multicultural team, we are the place for you. Portfolio Analyst Your Responsibilities Analyse fund documentation and assess real assets transactions in the fields of fund of funds, private equity, real estate, infrastructure, renewable energies, or private debt; Assess the eligibility of the proposed investment in terms of strategy, investment objectives, liquidity, ownership and/ or sustainability; Perform initial and on-going AML /KYC/ TF and Sanctions checks; Process subscription documents, fill out AML/ KYC check lists, tax forms or any other related to the subscription document; Update, maintain and improve existing Excel based portfolio management cash flow models / liquidity management tools (DCF); Monitor and manage the liquidity of the fund on daily basis, evaluate the financial performance by comparing and analysing actual results with plans and forecasts; Identify and drive process improvements, including the creation of standard and ad-hoc reporting, tools, and Excel dashboards; Work closely with the senior portfolio management personnel to ensure sound decision-making process; Support by the implementation of regulatory changes. Your profile 0 - 5 years of business finance or other relevant experience; BA, BS, or B.Com degree required (Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Accounting/Finance/Economics); Relevant professional experience in the analysis and monitoring of transactions in the alternative assets space ideally gained by an investment manager, fund servicer or consulting company; Profound knowledge of the regulatory framework regarding alternative investment funds (AIFMD); Good understanding of valuation models for alternative assets; Strong command of the MS-Office suit in particular Excel; Self-starter with excellent interpersonal communication and problem-solving skills; Interest in capital markets and investment fund products; Ability to streamline functions and passion to learn and grow; Fluency in English is mandatory, knowledge of any other European language in particular German will be considered as an asset. You can look forward to an interesting and broad field of activities within a successfully growing company. You will experience the advantages of a company of manageable size, flat hierarchies and an attractive work environment providing you a long-term perspective for your personal and professional development. As a vital team member and in return for your expertise, inclusive approach and commitment, we'll provide a favourable salary and the chance to join a passionate and welcoming team. Benefits As a truly global business, we tailor benefits to each location to safeguard our people and respect local cultures and ways of working. Our people are our greatest asset, and we invest in talent development. Join our global network, and you will benefit from education support, sponsorship and in-house training programs. Disclaimer: Unsolicited CVs sent to Apex (Talent Acquisition Team or Hiring Managers) by recruitment agencies will not be accepted for this position. Apex operates a direct sourcing model and where agency assistance is required, the Talent Acquisition team will engage directly with our exclusive recruitment partners.

title: LLP - Operations Excellence Manager
description: About the job Be An Essential Part Of Everyday Life DHL Supply Chain is the world‚Äôs leading contract logistics provider that combines value-added and management services with fulfillment and distribution. At DHL Supply Chain we are committed to looking after tomorrow & today with our Environment, Social, and Governance (ESG) strategy. So what's it like to work for DHL Supply Chain? At DHL we‚Äôre proud of our international reach as it brings together people with a wide range of skills, experiences, cultures, and viewpoints. We see the diversity of our employees as a genuine strength and we‚Äôre proud of our supportive work environment where employees are given the tools and training they need to learn, grow and succeed. We are offering an exciting opportunity for the position of Operations Excellence Regional Manager. In this position you will play a crucial role to support our vision of becoming a Great place to work for all. Position located in Valencia Center of Excellence. Visit us for further info: https://dhlinsights.dhlsupplychain.dhl.com/ao-lead-logistics-partner What will your responsibilities be? Accountable owner and leader of the Central Operations Excellence function regional cluster Responsible for the communication, delivery & implementation of the Central OPERATIONS EXCELLENCE agenda & driving an OPERATIONS EXCELLENCE culture to support our the 3 bottom lines Build partnerships, strong diverse stakeholder relationships and act as an enabler for our business strategies to be achieved Ensure regulatory and customer expectations and standards are consistently met Drive cross collaboration with functional and operational leads to identify & share best practice, ensure standardisation and drive continuious improvement To present Central OPERATIONS EXCELLENCE solutions to prospective customers, inspiring confidence in LLP‚Äôs Central OPERATIONS EXCELLENCE service deliverables Achieve KPI targets, implement initiatives and deliver continuous improvement opportunities Lead and build Central OPERATIONS EXCELLENCE Cluster team, review resource reqs and budget to deliver excellent, consistent service that meets business & customer needs, present & future Provide leadership, coaching, support and excellence in line management Maximise standards compliance in H&S, Quality Management, Risk Management, minimize deviations from process and requirements, maximise improvements. Maximise crisis resilience and response capability, minimize recovery times of critical services. You won‚Äôt find another OEManager position like the one you‚Äôll find with DHL Supply Chain. description: About the job Fundada en 2003, Prosolia Energy es un grupo empresarial l√≠der en el sector de las energ√≠as renovables, con operaciones en los mercados de Espa√±a, Portugal, Italia, Francia y Alemania a trav√©s de nuestras filiales. title: Operations Manager, West Europe
description: About the job The world needs more Intrepid people: We‚Äôre looking for a confident and experienced Operations Manager to lead our trips across West Europe. Based in Valencia in a hybrid capacity, this full-time role is responsible for the day-to-day running of our tours, supporting a large team of leaders, and ensuring every trip meets Intrepid‚Äôs high standards. You‚Äôll manage trip delivery across multiple countries, lead recruitment and training for our group leaders and guides, and respond quickly when things don‚Äôt go to plan. You‚Äôll also play a key role in improving systems, managing budgets, and making sure our safety and operational policies are followed. This is a great opportunity for someone who knows Europe well, thrives in fast-paced environments, and brings a strong understanding of what great group travel looks like. Some of the experience you‚Äôll bring with you may include: Senior-level operations management experience across multiple locations or countries Strong knowledge of Europe‚Äôs travel industry and cultural landscape Previous experience as a Group Leader or in a similar on-the-ground role Proven ability to recruit, train and manage large remote teams Confidence managing operational budgets, safety processes and incident response A process-driven mindset with strong cross-functional collaboration skills Fluency in English and Spanish is essential, with any other European languages such as Italian, French and Portuguese as a plus. A bit about our team: You‚Äôll be joining a passionate regional team who care deeply about what we do and how we do it. We support each other, challenge each other, and work hard to ensure Intrepid trips are nothing short of exceptional. If you want to make an impact in a meaningful travel company ‚Äì we think you‚Äôll love it here. Our people reflect the diversity of our customers and the communities we visit: Intrepid is made up of 71 nationalities in over 30 countries, and we recognise that diversity makes us a stronger business. We support a culture where people can be themselves and encourage applications from people of all backgrounds. Including First Nations People, LGBTQI+ people, those living with a disability, or from disadvantaged backgrounds, and all people from different ethnicities, races, and religions. Rewarding and developing our people is important to us, some of our work perks include: Flexible work options, such as work-from-home options and the ability to 'work from anywhere' 4 weeks a year A free Intrepid trip every year, plus generous discounts for families, and close friends 5 extra days of leave a year for use on Intrepid trip's A minimum of 10 weeks paid parental leave for all parents, and other additional leave provisions. Access to e-learning platforms, professional development and mentor programs 20 hours of volunteer leave every year to use on causes most important to you Employee Assistance Program, a 24/7 service that offers counselling for you and your family We are Real. Together. Ambitious. Impactful. These are our values and to us they're more than just words, they are the pillars of our success and every day it's our people and the work they do that bring them to life.

title: Portfolio Analyst
description: About the job FundRock is a Pan-European leading independent UCITS management company and AIFM (Alternative Investment Fund Manager). Our clients are established blue-chip companies and leaders in their domestic market. We invest in our people, enabling you to develop your skills and build on your experience. If you like the idea of working for an ambitious and growing company, as part of a multicultural team, we are the place for you. Portfolio Manager / Portfolio Analyst (m/f/d) - Real Assets Your Responsibilities Analyse fund documentation and assess real assets transactions in the fields of fund of funds, private equity, real estate, infrastructure, renewable energies, or private debt. Assess the eligibility of the proposed investment in terms of strategy, investment objectives, liquidity, ownership and/ or sustainability. Perform initial and on-going AML /KYC/ TF and Sanctions checks. Update, maintain and improve existing Excel based portfolio management cash flow models (DCF) Monitor and manage the liquidity of the fund on daily basis, evaluate the financial performance by comparing and analysing actual results with plans and forecasts. Identify and drive process improvements, including the creation of standard and ad-hoc reporting, tools, and Excel dashboards Work closely with the portfolio management collegues in Luxembourg to ensure sound decision-making process Support by the implementation of regulatory changes Your profile 3 - 5 years of business finance or other relevant experience BA, BS, or B.Com degree required (Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Accounting/Finance/Economics) Relevant professional experience in the analysis and monitoring of transactions in the alternative assets space ideally gained by an investment manager, fund servicer or consulting company Profound knowledge of the regulatory framework regarding alternative investment funds (AIFMD) Good understanding of valuation models for alternative assets Strong command of the MS-Office suit in particular Excel Self-starter with excellent interpersonal communication and problem-solving skills Interest in capital markets and investment fund products Ability to streamline functions and passion to learn and grow Fluency in English is mandatory, knowledge of any other European language in particular German will be considered as an asset. You can look forward to an interesting and broad field of activities within a successfully growing company. You will experience the advantages of a company of manageable size, flat hierarchies and an attractive work environment providing you a long-term perspective for your personal and professional development. Interested? If you are interested in this challenge, we look forward to receiving your application documents (motivation letter, CV, testimonials/reference letters) including additional information about your earliest possible starting date as well as your salary expectations via e-mail to hr-lux@apexgroup.com. As a vital team member and in return for your expertise, inclusive approach and commitment, we'll provide a favourable salary and the chance to join a passionate and welcoming team. Benefits As a truly global business, we tailor benefits to each location to safeguard our people and respect local cultures and ways of working. Our people are our greatest asset, and we invest in talent development. Join our global network, and you will benefit from education support, sponsorship and in-house training programs. Disclaimer: Unsolicited CVs sent to Apex (Talent Acquisition Team or Hiring Managers) by recruitment agencies will not be accepted for this position. Apex operates a direct sourcing model and where agency assistance is required, the Talent Acquisition team will engage directly with our exclusive recruitment partners.

title: Governance Risk & Compliance Analyst
description: About the job About XTEL At XTEL, we excel in understanding large FMCG players. As a leading software provider of sales automation solutions for the Consumer Goods Industry worldwide, our mission is to partner with our customers to unlock growth through smart investment and optimize their promotional plans. Position Overview XTEL is looking for a GRC Analyst who is driven, curious, and eager to grow. You‚Äôll work directly with the Director of Information Assurance to help build and scale a forward-thinking and efficient security & compliance program. This isn‚Äôt a check the box compliance role, we‚Äôre looking for someone who wants to reimagine how GRC is done and isn‚Äôt afraid to roll up their sleeves to make it happen. This is an ideal opportunity for someone earlier in their GRC career who is looking to learn, contribute meaningfully, and be part of a high impact team. Responsibilities Support the ongoing operation and improvement of XTEL‚Äôs ISMS. Draft, review, and maintain security & compliance policies, standards, and procedures, ensuring they meet evolving compliance requirements and business needs. Assist with risk assessments and treatment plans. Contribute to our Third Party Risk Management (TPRM) efforts for evaluating vendors beyond just sending out lengthy questionnaires. Assist with client security questionnaires, RFPs, and due diligence requests. Help monitor compliance obligations across frameworks including ISO 27001, SOC 2, SOC 1/ISAE 3402, GDPR, and NIS2. Support ESG initiatives by collecting, analyzing, and reporting on sustainability metrics, including greenhouse gas emissions and energy usage, to meet investor and stakeholder requirements. Assist in responding to customer RFPs and inquiries related to ESG, ensuring alignment with sustainability goals and regulatory frameworks. Collaborate with stakeholders across IT, Product, Engineering, HR, etc. to implement security controls. Continuously look for ways to automate, streamline, and modernize how we manage compliance and security operations. Contribute to incident response and BCP/DRP planning and testing. Qualifications You‚Äôre motivated, adaptable, and eager to learn. You have 2-5 years of experience in security, compliance, or risk management roles, particularly in cloud based SaaS environments. You have hands on experience with ISO 27001 and SOC 2. You think of GRC as more than just documentation and spreadsheets ‚Äì you see it as a system to be optimized and improved with technology. You‚Äôve supported or helped manage ISMS operations and understand what makes policies and procedures useful. You participated in or supported risk assessments. You‚Äôre organized, self-directed, and thrive in environments where you can take ownership. Nice to have: Experience using GRC platforms such as Drata, Vanta, Secureframe, etc. Experience within Microsoft 365 and Azure environments. Experience with automation, low-code tools, or scripting to improve workflows and documentation processes. What We Offer A challenging role in a fast-growing AI-driven revenue management company. A diverse and international team with strong ownership and a can-do mentality. Opportunities to contribute to the organization's growth and development. A cross-functional role spanning geographies and departments. Flexible working with hybrid and remote options (HQ in Bologna). Location Preferences: Our headquarters is located in Casalecchio di Reno, Bologna, and we offer hybrid work arrangements. While we prioritize candidates who are based in Bologna and the surrounding areas for hybrid work, we are open to considering other options on a case-by-case basis. Equal Opportunity Statement If you have strengths to share, we‚Äôd love to hear from you. We value diverse backgrounds and experiences, so don‚Äôt hesitate to apply even if you don‚Äôt meet all criteria. XTEL is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform crucial job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment.

title: Investment and Operations Intern (6-12 months)
description: About the job Are you passionate about tackling climate change and driving impactful solutions? Join our team as an Investment and Operations Intern, where your skills will contribute to advancing natural climate solutions and fostering sustainable growth. We‚Äôre looking for a long-term member to join our team and work from/relocate to Valencia. We actively encourage applications from diverse backgrounds, especially from women and underrepresented groups, as we strive to create an inclusive and empowering workplace. About the Role This position offers a unique opportunity for a motivated individual to grow professionally while contributing to investment analysis, project management, and market research. You‚Äôll collaborate closely with our investment and operations team, gaining hands-on experience in natural capital investment. Key Responsibilities: Investment Analysis: Support cash flow, IRR projections, and scenario analysis for land purchase decisions. Investment Management: Assist in designing and delivering quarterly/annual reports covering financial, climate, and community outcomes. Market Research: Conduct in-depth research on the Voluntary Carbon Market (VCM) and competitor analysis. Sales Support: Manage CRM tools and support the Sales team ahead of major events. Strategic Assistance: Provide operational and strategic support to our leadership team. What We‚Äôre Looking For We understand no single candidate meets every qualification. If you‚Äôre excited about this role and our mission, we encourage you to apply! Required Skills: Advanced use of Microsoft Applications (Word, Powerpoint, Excel). Previous academic or work exposure to modelling in Excel. Fluency in English (written and spoken). Ability to work autonomously and diligently in remote settings. Familiarity with Google Suite, amongst other remote working tools. Theoretical understanding of financial concepts such as IRR, NPV, and discount rates. Desired Skills (Not Mandatory): Working knowledge of Spanish and/or Portuguese is a strong plus. German and/or French is a nice-to-have. Experience in a startup environment is a plus. Experience with financial analysis and/or CRM platforms. Familiarity with GIS tools (e.g., QGIS, ArcGIS) or coding (e.g., Python, VBA, R). Understanding of financial statements (P&L, Balance Sheet) & project finance reporting. Knowledge of the voluntary carbon market is highly desirable. Knowledge of natural climate solutions is highly desirable. About NatureRe Capital At NatureRe Capital, we are dedicated to ‚Äúinvesting in nature, restoring biodiversity and removing carbon at scale.‚Äù Our innovative business model integrates carbon, biodiversity and financial expertise to deliver impactful natural climate solutions with sound returns. Here‚Äôs why you‚Äôll love working with us: Mission-Driven Culture: Join a passionate and mission-driven team tackling both climate change and biodiversity loss. Learning Opportunities: We prioritize training and mentorship to support your growth. Flexibility: Remote work with a focus on work-life balance. Balanced Leadership: A multi-faceted and international team (40% women, 16 nationalities, significant age range), striving to increase female representation in leadership roles and valuing balanced perspectives in decision-making. Work Expectations We value balance and inclusivity. While this internship requires full-time availability, we respect personal commitments and encourage healthy work-life integration. Application Deadline: 15/09/2025 How to Apply: Please submit your CV and a brief cover letter outlining your interest in the role to career@nature-re.com. Help us shape a sustainable future‚Äîapply today! By submitting your application, you consent to the processing of your personal data for recruitment purposes, in accordance with EU data protection regulations (GDPR). Your information will be handled confidentially and used solely for evaluating your candidacy for this role.

title: Senior Analyst (Growth)
description: About the job Simple Life is the #1 AI-powered health coaching app for adults who want to lose weight and enjoy a healthier lifestyle‚Äîwithout the stress or extremes. Our mission is to empower people to feel their best every day. By challenging traditional, restrictive approaches, Simple offers a more sustainable method grounded in ease, personalization, and real-life support. Simple has had over 17 million downloads and more than 300,000 5-star reviews, having helped millions lose weight successfully and sustainably. Simple has earned recognition as Best Virtual Coach and one of the Top 100 AI companies ‚Äî all thanks to a dedicated global team driving real impact.With SIMPLE as a partner in their pocket, users feel cared for and empowered to embrace ‚Äî and stick to ‚Äî new healthy habits. To learn more, visit simple.life. Right now we are looking for a talented Senior Product Analyst who enjoys exploring product metrics, uncovering insights, and helping drive growth through analytical thinking. Push the pace of innovation and build a future of a healthier world with us! What We‚Äôre Looking For Advanced SQL skills ‚Äî ability to design, write, and maintain complex, highly optimized queries on large-scale datasets, using advanced joins, window functions, CTEs, and aggregations; confidence in reviewing query plans and improving performance. Experience working with ETL pipelines and building data workflows (Airflow, dbt, or similar); understanding how to ensure data quality, reliability, and timely delivery. Python for data analysis and automation, including data wrangling, visualization, and statistical analysis. Experience forecasting LTV using cohort analysis, survival models, statistical techniques, or machine learning approaches (at least one of these); ability to select the most appropriate method depending on data quality and the product‚Äôs stage. Experience with any BI tool (Looker, Superset, Tableau, Power BI, or similar); ability to build intuitive dashboards and self-serve analytics. Solid grasp of statistics and experimentation, including A/B test design, power calculations, and post-hoc analysis. Strong communication skills to effectively collaborate with growth, marketing, engineering, and other teams. A proactive, ownership mindset ‚Äî someone who enjoys exploring data, spotting trends, and turning them into actionable insights and opportunities. Professional proficiency in both Russian and English (B2 or above) to comfortably communicate with international and local teams. Nice To Have Experience working as a product or data analyst specifically in a subscription-based service (SaaS, mobile subscriptions, OTT, etc.). Hands-on experience with machine learning libraries (XGBoost, CatBoost, LightGBM, etc.) for customer segmentation or predictive modeling. What You‚Äôll Do Work on improving the existing LTV forecasting model and develop additional predictive models as needed; Participate in evaluating pricing experiments and interpreting results to inform product and marketing strategies; Build reports and dashboards to provide visibility into product trends and opportunities; Identify patterns and insights in data to determine optimal pricing strategies and uncover new growth levers; Perks And Benefits Open-minded teams, a welcoming and inclusive company culture, plus the opportunity to make a real difference with a game-changing health tech product; A competitive salary package based on your unique expertise, skillset, and impact on the product plus stock options; In-office, remote and hybrid work opportunities; Relocation package (Cyprus) - optional; The equipment whatever you need to be happy and productive; A premium SIMPLE subscription; 21 days annual leave, plus bank holidays (those observed where you live); Flexible hours. We focus on your results, not how long you spend at your desk. Palta is a health & well-being technology company. We're guided by real passion and curiosity to transform bright ideas into worldwide products while delivering real results.

title: Snr Operations Manager

Proactive and collaborative approach, ideally with start-up or scale-up experience. This role would suit someone passionate about delivering operational excellence in a dynamic and technically complex environment. If you are interested in discussing this Senior Operations Manager position further, please contact Emily Wright @ IC Resources

title: Security Operations Automation Engineer
description: About the job Say hello to possibilities. First, a little about us, we‚Äôre the $2 billion global leader in cloud-based communications and collaboration software. We are fundamentally changing the nature of human interaction‚Äîgiving people the freedom to connect powerfully and personally from anywhere, at any time, on any device. We‚Äôre currently looking for a strong SecOps Automation Engineer. As a SecOps Automation Engineer at RingCentral, your primary responsibilities are to maintain and automate systems for: vulnerability scanning, log delivery, SIEM infrastructure, and parsing, and system inventory. You will work primarily within the Security Operations team. As a member of the SecOps Automation team, your primary customers will be the SOC, SecOps Infrastructure, and Vulnerability Management teams. Responsibilities: Maintain and develop Vulnerability Management scans automation Maintain and develop infrastructure automation Maintain and develop integrations between security products Automate manual processes through code and non-code tooling Deliver committed projects on time Support SecOps internal customers as part of an on-call rotation Requirements: Have strong python coding skills Have strong knowledge of Linux (RedHat preferred) Have a familiarity with devops tools (Kubernetes, Terraform, Ansible, Jenkins) Have a familiarity with cloud concepts (AWS/GCP) Have a familiarity in several of the facets of security operations: Security network infrastructure and components (Firewalls, Web App Firewalls, IDS/IPS, etc) Endpoint protection for traditional OSes and containers (EDR/XDR, malware prevention, file integrity monitoring, etc) Security Events and incidents, including log sources, SIEM integrations, playbooks, runbooks, policies Vulnerability detection (Pentesting, scanning, red team, etc) Vulnerability Management Be project oriented and have great time management skills Be comfortable presenting their coding and design decisions to peers early and often Qualifications / Requirements: 3+ years in coding proficiency in scripting languages Fluent in Linux, preferably Red Hat Linux Knowledge of broad security topics such as encryption, application security, malware, ransomware Preferred Skills/Experience: Direct experience delivering internal tools and automation Experience as SOC analyst Experience in vulnerability management / /patch management What we offer: Well-coordinated professional team. Life assurance and private medical insurance. Competitive salary. Great opportunities for self-realization, professional and career growth. Corporate training programs, free language courses. Excellent work environment and good collaboration. Opportunity to be a part of the international company. RingCentral is deeply committed to equality and values a diverse workforce. We welcome individuals from all backgrounds and walks of life to join us. Regardless of your profile, personal circumstances, or unique characteristics, you belong here. We would be thrilled to have you as part of our team.

title: Salesforce Business Analyst
description: About the job Omega CRM is a Merkle & Dentsu company, leader in development of Customer Experience services, with +20 years of experience in the use of Technology applied to Marketing and providing a unique Customer Relationship with mainly focus on Innovation is looking for a Salesforce Business Analyst. Job Description Requirements Analysis. Design and implement functional solutions in projects. Provide effort estimations for projects. Work in coordination with the rest of the Omega team and/or the client to contribute to the fulfillment of project objectives. Analyze and improve application performance. Collaborate with technology providers when required by the project. Contribute to the validation of the solution against functional requirements. Comply with the agreed software quality standards set by Omega's Technical Management. Generate functional documentation for completed projects. Collaborate within Omega's community of practice by sharing knowledge. Required Experience Minimum of 4 years work experience with Salesforce administration, configuration and consulting roles. Experience in business process analysis and redesign. Experience in functional design and implementation of Salesforce solutions to support sales, customer service, and after-sales processes, ensuring continuous improvement and user adoption Experience with different clouds such as Sales, Service, Marketing Cloud, Community, etc. Experience with Agile methodology. Oral and written fluent in English. WHAT DO WE OFFER Permanent contract. Flexible Schedule. We make it easy. Balance your professional and personal life. Certifications plan. Improve your skills and get the official certificate from our main partners. Home Office. You decide and we support you. Flexible retribution (public transport ticket, Ticket restaurtant, ‚Ä¶). Health insurance. OMEGA in action. Our commitment to a better society is not just an intention Professional development: Evolve, grow and get where you want to go. What do We offer Permanent contract. Flexible Schedule. We make it easy. Balance your professional and personal life. Trainings & Certifications. Improve your skills and get the official certificate from our main partners. Home Office. Flexible retribution (public transport ticket, Ticket restaurant, ‚Ä¶). Health insurance. OMEGA in action. Our commitment to a better society is not just an intention. About us Omega CRM, a Merkle Company, is a global digital company specialising in accelerating the Business Experience (BX) of our clients through customer-centric solutions, technology, and data ‚Äì all enhanced by AI. Together with Merkle, we form the largest Customer Experience Management (CXM) agency in Spain, and as part of the dentsu group, we offer end-to-end solutions that integrate media, creativity, content, technology, and strategy to deliver real business impact. With over 23 years of experience, a team of 580+ professionals from 24 nationalities, and 2,500+ certifications, Omega CRM is a recognised leader in the Salesforce ecosystem in Spain. We operate across key industries including Retail, Healthcare, Pharma, Real Estate, Education, and Non-Profit, delivering omnichannel experiences in Customer Service, eCommerce, Marketing, and Analytics. Client satisfaction is at our core (rating: 4.9/5), and we‚Äôve been recognised with awards such as Salesforce Partner of the Year FY23 and Most Innovative Project (Iberia). At Omega CRM, we believe in growth through people ‚Äì guided by our values: #Talent, #Flexibility, #Commitment, and #Innovation. We grow #Together.

title: Finance Operations Intern
description: About the job Company Description Are you ready to trade your job for a journey? Become a FlyMate! Passion, excitement & global collaboration are all core to what it means to be a FlyMate. At Flywire, we‚Äôre on a mission to deliver the world‚Äôs most important and complex payments. We use our Flywire Advantage - the combination of our next-gen payments platform, proprietary payment network and vertical specific software, to help our clients get paid, and help their customers pay with ease - no matter where they are in the world. What more do we need to truly be unstoppable? Perhaps, that is you! Who We Are Flywire is a global payments enablement and software company, founded more than a decade ago to solve high-stakes, high-value payments in higher education. We‚Äôve since scaled into new regions and industry verticals and expanded our product offerings to deliver meaningful value to our clients around the world. Today we support more than 4,600 clients across the global education, healthcare, travel & B2B industries, with diverse payment methods across 240 countries & territories and more than 140 currencies. With over 1,200 global FlyMates, representing more than 40 nationalities, and in 12 offices world-wide, we‚Äôre looking for FlyMates to join the next stage of our journey as we continue to grow. Job Description The Opportunity: We are seeking a Finance Operations Intern to join our APAC Finance team. This internship offers a unique opportunity to contribute directly to key operational processes while gaining exposure to the financial backbone of a global technology company. The successful candidate will support daily finance operations focused on transaction reconciliation, reporting, and revenue share coordination. You‚Äôll work closely with our experienced Finance team and gain hands-on training in critical accounting workflows and financial systems. Key Responsibilities Perform daily bank reconciliations across approximately 10 APAC bank accounts, reviewing and validating ~400 transactions per day. Process and book corporate card transactions, including expense classification and reporting (~300 monthly transactions). Assist in the preparation and coordination of Partner Revenue Share files under the guidance of senior team members ‚Äî a process that currently spans ~4 business days. Collaborate with the Finance and Accounting teams to ensure accurate record-keeping and timely reporting. Identify and escalate discrepancies or anomalies in transactional data. Support ad hoc finance projects, reporting requests, and documentation as needed. Qualifications Qualifications: Recent graduate with a degree in Finance, Accounting, Business, or a related field. Strong attention to detail and comfort working with large volumes of transactional data. Proficiency in Excel or Google Sheets; experience with financial systems (e.g., NetSuite, SAP, or similar) is a plus. Highly organized with a proactive attitude and a willingness to learn. Strong verbal and written communication skills. Availability to work full-time for the duration of the internship (typically 6‚Äì12 months). Additional Information Submit today and get started! We are excited to get to know you! Throughout our process you can expect to meet with different FlyMates including the Hiring Manager, Peers on the team, the VP of the department, and a skills assessment. Your Talent Acquisition Partner will walk you through the steps and be your ‚Äúgo-to‚Äù person for any questions. Flywire is an equal opportunity employer. With over 40 nationalities across 12 different offices, and diversity and inclusion at the core of our people agenda, we believe our FlyMates are our greatest asset, and we‚Äôre excited to watch our unique culture evolve with each new hire.

title: Group Financial Reporting Analyst
description: About the job We offer an opportunity you simply won‚Äôt find anywhere else. In less than six years, Mileway has grown into Europe‚Äôs leader in last mile logistics real estate, with a 550-plus team across more than twenty six offices in eleven countries. Join Mileway as a Group Financial Reporting Analyst and become part of our dynamic, pan-European team. Based in our Valencia Centre of Excellence and reporting to the Group Consolidation & Reporting Manager in Amsterdam, you‚Äôll play a key role in shaping and improving our financial reporting processes. This highly visible role offers the opportunity to contribute to a best-in-class financial reporting function while supporting the consolidation of over 500 legal entities. You‚Äôll work closely with the headquarters finance team in Amsterdam and collaborate with teams across the organization‚Äîincluding Investment Accounting, Tax, and FP&A. We‚Äôre looking for someone who combines operational excellence with the ambition to grow alongside our rapidly expanding business. Working at Mileway We offer an opportunity you simply won‚Äôt find anywhere else. Launched in 2019, Mileway has rapidly grown into Europe‚Äôs leader in last-mile logistics real estate, with a team of over 550 across more than twenty offices in 11 countries. From the start, Mileway set out to be a different kind of real estate company, with a cloud-based IT infrastructure and a team that combines local expertise with the pooled strengths of a pan-European presence. Our culture is fast-paced and highly international, with team members from more than 50 countries, bringing diverse perspectives and a ‚Äúcan-do‚Äù attitude to everything we do. While we have already achieved a lot, we‚Äôre only just getting started ‚Äì our purpose is to be Europe‚Äôs leading provider of last mile logistics real estate, enabling businesses to thrive, driving sustainability forward, and shaping the cities of tomorrow. To get there, we live by our values: Drive, Trust, Grow, Together. At Mileway, we believe company growth comes from supporting the growth of our combined capabilities. That‚Äôs why we offer an in-house learning & development program where personal, professional, and business development go hand in hand, helping you carve out your own unique career path. You‚Äôll be based at our Valencia office. While we embrace a flexible approach to work, our policy requires working from the office three days a week. To support this, we provide a state-of-the-art technology package to keep you connected at all times. What you will do Support the Group Controllership team in the consolidation of over 500 entities. Assist in preparing high-quality consolidated financial statements in accordance with IFRS. Manage the automated intercompany elimination process. Contribute to timely and accurate internal and external financial reporting. Review and analyze data from Investment Accounting teams. Identify and resolve data discrepancies through analysis and collaboration. Become a key user of our consolidation platform (OneStream), supporting database maintenance and reporting design. Maintain financial databases to reflect changes in legal structure or chart of accounts. Prepare and analyze financial reports, including KPIs, variance analysis, and deep-dive insights. Identify and implement opportunities for process improvement and automation. Serve as a key liaison with internal teams, auditors, and senior management What will you bring Education: Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Finance or Economics required. Master‚Äôs or accounting qualification (RA, ACCA, or equivalent) is a plus. Experience: 4‚Äì5 years in audit, consolidation, or financial reporting, ideally in a fast-paced, international environment. Mindset: Proactive, analytical, and solution-oriented, with a collaborative approach. Expertise: Comfortable working at both group and entity levels. Solid understanding of IFRS and technical group accounting. Tech Skills: Proficient in ERP systems and Microsoft Office Suite. Experience with consolidation tools like OneStream or Oracle Hyperion is advantageous. Attention to Detail: Consistently delivers accurate, high-quality work. Autonomy: Able to manage tasks independently and adapt to shifting priorities. Communication: Excellent written and verbal English skills. Bonus: Knowledge of real estate is helpful but not required. If you're ready to grow your career in a high-impact role at a fast-growing, forward-thinking company, Mileway is the place for you. Our vision is to be the number one gateway to urban communities. To get there, we live our values: Drive, Trust, Grow, Together.

title: HR Specialist & Operations (Temporary)
description: About the job Vantive is a vital organ therapy company on a mission to extend lives and expand possibilities for patients and care teams everywhere. For 70 years, our team has driven meaningful innovations in kidney care. As we build on our legacy, we are deepening our commitment to elevating the dialysis experience through digital solutions and advanced services, while looking beyond kidney care and investing in transforming vital organ therapies. Greater flexibility and efficiency in therapy administration for care teams, and longer, fuller lives for patients‚Äî that is what Vantive aspires to deliver. We believe Vantive will not only build our leadership in the kidney care space, it will also offer meaningful work to those who join us. At Vantive, you will become part of a community of people who are focused, courageous and don‚Äôt settle for the mediocre. Each of us is driven to help improve patients‚Äô lives worldwide. Join us in advancing our mission to extend lives and expand possibilities. Summary Support managers, employees and wider HR colleagues through the provision of customer focused HR operation services. Ensure the accuracy, timeliness, and completeness of the monthly payroll in close coordination with payroll provider. Responsible for administering local employee benefit and compensation programs. Key Accountabilities Payroll & Admin Services Provide support to Managers and HR Business Partners with administrative processes within the employee lifecycle. Being first point of contact for employees on all HR Operations related enquiries, such HR systems, policies, procedures, pay, benefits, etc Prepare and maintain employment records related to events, such as hiring, termination, Facilitate the use of HR systems and improve the use of manager and employee self-service, ensuring complete and accurate record management at all times. Dealing day to day with the Payroll provider: entering data (new hires, terminations, leaves, settlements, etc.) into payroll and administrative databases and software programs (around 200 employees) Keep abreast of the payroll processing system and changes in wage/tax laws, and applies changes as appropriate Taxes payments (Social Security, 190, 111) Perform account balance and payroll reconciliations. Prepare financial reports for accounting and auditing purposes Collaborate with other HR colleagues on labor issues related to the external Administration (Inspections, Audits and litigations). Prepare Severance calculation and dismissal letters Ensure that employee administration and payroll activities are in accordance with Companies‚Äô policies, agreed work details and in compliance with statutory requirements. Benefits Management Administer employee benefit programs and employees‚Äô compensation plans (Pension Plan, life insurance, medical insurance and flexible benefits), ensuring all practices are legally compliant and in line with Companies‚Äô policies and procedures Provide support to employees and managers inquiries regarding policies, procedures, processes, eligibility, enrolment and other questions Collaborate with the other HR colleagues on labor issues related to the external Prepare of regular audits and reports regarding salary information (Unions reports) and cost analysis to support HR decisions Key Contact for compensation Surveys Essential Criteria Qualifications Degree in HR management Law/Labor Relations, or other related fields A minimum 3 years' experience working on HR generalist roles Good English level is a must. Spanish mother tongue. Basic knowledge of Italian and/or Portuguese is very welcome. Skills & Competencies Working knowledge on payroll practices, accounting principles and compensation & benefits. High numerical aptitude and analytical skills Detail-oriented Good communication and interpersonal skills Strong organizational and time management skills Good English level is a must Knowledge & Experience Working knowledge on payroll practices, accounting principles and compensation & benefits Excellent Microsoft Office skills Reasonable Accommodation Vantive is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities globally. If, because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or interview process, please click on the link here and let us know the nature of your request along with your contact information. Form Link Recruitment Fraud Notice Vantive has discovered incidents of employment scams, where fraudulent parties pose as Vantive employees, recruiters, or other agents, and engage with online job seekers in an attempt to steal personal and/or financial information. To learn how you can protect yourself, review our Recruitment Fraud Notice.

title: Business Analyst/Product Owner. Healthcare. Clinical data
description: About the job Product Owner/ Sr. Business Analyst Platform Engineering & Clinical data, Trial data, clinical trials Phase 1-3 We are looking for a skilled and proactive Product owner to support and lead a team of Engineers delivering scalable, cloud-native solutions in the Healthcare domain. This role is focused on projects involving clinical trial data, requiring a deep understanding of Clinical trials (Phase 1-3) workflows, data standards, and compliance. The ideal candidate will have experience working with modern clinical platforms, cell therapy context including patient journey mapping, chain of identity/custody, and TRiSP processes; and the ability to bridge business needs with technical execution. Plus, will lead the product lifecycle and prioritization for the orchestration system and similar clinical trial and therapeutics systems. He will act as the bridge between stakeholders, engineering, QA, and end-users (clinicians, coordinators). Responsible for value delivery aligned with cell therapy , drug development and testing , audit reporting, clinical data reporting workflows. Requirements 7+ years of experience as a Business Analyst or Product Owner working with healthcare clinical data. Strong domain expertise in clinician-side and trials side processes. Understanding of HIPAA and best practices for managing PHI/PII in healthcare data environments. Familiarity with FHIR, HL7, and healthcare data integration standards. Experience developing detailed requirements documentation, data dictionaries, and system/process diagrams. Nice-to-haves Hands-on experience with data validation and profiling for large-scale claims datasets. Exposure to GCP , AWS, Azure, or and their native data services. Familiarity with both trials and clinical data models and their integration Experience with BI/reporting tools such as Power BI, Looker, or Tableau. Bachelor's or Master's degree in Healthcare Informatics, Information Systems, or a related field. Core Responsibilities Act as a liaison between business stakeholders and the Data Engineering team, translating complex clinical data requirements into actionable development tasks. Lead discovery and requirements workshops focused on operations, data intake, chain of custody and other related processes. Document end-to-end data flows, business logic, data mapping, and acceptance criteria for ingestion, transformation, and reporting of trial related data. Own and maintain the product backlog, grooming epics and user stories. Prioritize features based on patient journey insights and commercial scalability. Engage with cross-functional stakeholders (clinical ops, QA, regulatory, sites). Drive agile ceremonies: sprint planning, reviews, retrospectives. Translate regulatory and CoI/CoC needs into technical requirements. Align product vision with roadmap and commercialization/ Research goals. Define success KPIs (e.g., scheduling efficiency, alert accuracy). Oversee user research, prototyping, and usability assessments. Ensure integration with EMR, LIMS, EDC, and drug manufacturing , supply chain systems. Track product progress and adjust roadmap based on feedback and pilots. Design role-based access control and user provisioning workflows. Implement audit trail monitoring and exception logging. Review and enforce HIPAA, GDPR, and 21 CFR Part 11 requirements. Conduct security risk assessments and pen testing coordination. Soft Skills Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to work across business and technical teams. Strong problem-solving skills and attention to data accuracy. Self-starter with the ability to lead initiatives with minimal oversight. Passion for improving healthcare operations through better data and technology. Why Join Us? Influence data-driven decision making in healthcare with real-world impact. Work on modern cloud platforms (Google Cloud, Databricks/Snowflake, AWS, etc.). Join a team of high-performing engineers and healthcare data experts. Thrive in a flexible, collaborative, and mission-driven environment. What We Offer Continuous learning and career growth opportunities Professional training and English/Spanish language classes Comprehensive medical insurance Mental health support Specialized benefits program with compensation for fitness activities, hobbies, pet care, and more Flexible working hours Inclusive and supportive culture About Us Established in 2011, Trinetix is a dynamic tech service provider supporting enterprise clients around the world. Headquartered in Nashville, Tennessee, we have a global team of over 1,000 professionals and delivery centers across Europe, the United States, and Argentina. We partner with leading global brands, delivering innovative digital solutions across Fintech, Professional Services, Logistics, Healthcare, and Agriculture. Our operations are driven by a strong business vision, a people-first culture, and a commitment to responsible growth. We actively give back to the community through various CSR activities and adhere to international principles for sustainable development and business ethics. To learn more about how we collect, process, and store your personal data, please review our Privacy Notice: https://www.trinetix.com/corporate-policies/privacy-notice

title: Cybersecurity Operations Consultant
description: About the job This job is sourced from a job board. Learn More UNICC is committed to achieving diversity and inclusion within its workforce, providing an environment that reflects the values enshrined in the Charter of the United Nations and encourages all qualified applicants, irrespective of gender, nationality, disabilities, sexual orientation, culture, religious and ethnic backgrounds to apply. UNICC is dedicated to the SDGs, making SDG-5 (Gender Equality) and SDG-10 (Reduce Inequalities) the organization goals. https://www.un.org/sustainabledevelopment/sustainable-development-goals/ The objective of the Centre is to provide trusted ICT services and digital business solutions to its Clients and Partner Organizations. Background Information The Cybersecurity Operations Consultant will be responsible for assisting the in the delivery of the Cybersecurity Operations services and projects aligned with the strategy and roadmap of UN Partner Organisation. This role requires a strong foundation in technical knowledge but also an ability to communicate complex security topics to a non-technical audience and work collaboratively across diverse teams. Main Duties And Responsibilities The incumbent will work under the direct supervision and guidance of the Chief, Cybersecurity Operations, of UNICC‚Äôs Partner Organization, and will be in close collaboration with UNICC‚Äôs Cybersecurity Operations Section (CSO) and other cybersecurity teams within UNICC‚Äôs Partner Organization. Investigate security alerts and anomalies identified through Google‚Äôs security tools (e.g. Google Security Command Center, Security Operations, DLP, etc.) as well as candidate incidents escalated by the SOC Team Collaborate with the Cybersecurity Operations Section and/or other cybersecurity teams to support architecture changes, development and implementation of new solutions and apply configuration hardening best practices in Google Environment Identify and suggest the implementation of new detection use cases required to monitor Google Environment for real-time threat detection Contribute to the development and maintenance of automation playbooks using Google Cloud Functions, SOAR, and Security Orchestration Identify and suggest architecture changes to enhance cybersecurity posture of ICT environment Support and participate in security risk assessments and audits related to Cloud environment Ensure that ICT environment maintains compliance with ISO 27001 standards, proactively tracking identified risks, managing mitigation activities, and escalating issues through appropriate channels when necessary Following UNICC cybersecurity best practices, manage vulnerabilities using Googlenative or third-party security tools (e.g. Qualys, Crowdstrike) Following the guidance of CISO and CSO sections monitor and act on assigned security operations related activities and the 24*7 SOC ensuring all security incidents are diligently followed through and remediated Support the integration of Google Cloud security environment with other security controls (e.g., Splunk, CrowdStrike) to enhance threat detection, incident response, and security operations Recruitment Profile Essential Experience and Skills required: A minimum of two (2) years of relevant experience in Information Technology, including in conducting or coordinating incident response or forensics in Google Cloud environment Proven experience in the implementation and design of security architecture, security controls, and best practices in Google Cloud environment Education Essential: First university degree in Management Information Systems, Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related area Languages English: Expert knowledge is required UNICC Global Competencies Teamwork:Develops and promotes effective relationships with colleagues and team members. Deals constructively with conflicts. Communicating:Expresses oneself clearly in conversations and interactions with others; listens actively. Produces effective written communications. Ensures that information is shared. Respecting and promoting individual and cultural differences:Demonstrates the ability to work constructively with people of all backgrounds and orientations. Respects differences and ensures that all can contribute. Knowing and managing yourself:Manages ambiguity and pressure in a self-reflective way. Uses criticism as a development opportunity. Seeks opportunities for continuous learning and professional growth. Producing results:Produces and delivers quality results. Is action oriented and committed to achieving outcomes. Moving forward in a changing environment:Is open to and proposes new approaches and ideas. Adapts and responds positively to change. Other Information Compensation Fee will be based either on the National Officer salary scales or the Individual Consultancy band levels (for Headquarters) National Officer Salary Scale For headquarters, Individual Consultancy band levels will be used Closing Date For Applications Applications will be accepted until midnight (Geneva Time) on the 22 May 2025 Notes Technical and/or personality tests may be carried out as part of the selection process Only short-listed candidates will be contacted Though you may not be selected for this advertised position, the UNICC will keep your application in a roster if your profile is deemed to be of potential interest for the Centre. You may thus be solicited by our HR department to participate in an interview for another position The UNICC workforce consists of many diverse nationalities, cultures, languages, and opinions. UNICC seeks to sustain and strengthen this diversity by ensuring equal opportunity and an inclusive working environment for its entire workforce. Applications are encouraged from all qualified candidates without distinction on grounds of race, ethnicity, sex, national origin, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation and gender identity. For applications to be valid, they must contain a motivation letter and the filled Personal History Form. PLEASE APPLY HERE:https://www.unicc.org/working-with-icc/cybersecurity-operations-consultant/

title: Campaign Operations Intern - German speaker
description: About the job Groupon is a marketplace where customers discover new experiences and services everyday and local businesses thrive. To date we have worked with over a million merchant partners worldwide, connecting over 16 million customers with deals across various categories. In a world often dominated by e-commerce giants, we stand out as one of the few platforms uniquely committed to helping local businesses succeed on a performance basis. Groupon is on a radical journey to transform our business with relentless pursuit of results. Even with thousands of employees spread across multiple continents, we still maintain a culture that inspires innovation, rewards risk-taking and celebrates success. The impact here can be immediate due to our scale and the speed of our transformation. We're a "best of both worlds" kind of company. We're big enough to have the resources and scale, but small enough that a single person has a surprising amount of autonomy and can make a meaningful impact. Location: Valencia, Spain (Hybrid) Role Overview: Groupon helps customers discover deals on local experiences. This role supports the back-end operations of merchant campaigns. The Campaign Operations Intern will support the back-end setup of Groupon merchant campaigns. This includes working with various teams to bring deals to life, ensuring all campaign details, forms, and configurations are accurate. This is a paid internship for candidates based in Valencia who are currently studying. Responsibilities: Support backend configuration of Groupon merchant campaigns. Assist in managing editorial assets for campaigns. Track and apply feedback and revisions from internal teams. Ensure campaigns meet editorial and technical standards before launch. Maintain internal documentation for campaign workflows. Communication with merchants for any information requests Help troubleshoot and resolve configuration issues. Qualifications: Fluent C1 in German Pursuing or recently completed a degree in Marketing, Communications, Business, or related field. Strong attention to detail. Experience with content management systems or workflow tools is preferred. Familiarity with Salesforce CRM is a plus. Basic HTML or CMS experience is a plus. Strong communication skills. Collaborative mindset. What You‚Äôll Gain: Experience in e-commerce and local deals. Exposure to Groupon campaign processes. Collaboration with various teams. Skills in digital content management and campaign configuration. Groupon is an AI-First Company We‚Äôre committed to building smarter, faster, and more innovative ways of working‚Äîand AI plays a key role in how we get there. We encourage candidates to leverage AI tools during the hiring process where it adds value, and we‚Äôre always keen to hear how technology improves the way you work. If you‚Äôre passionate about AI or curious to explore how it can elevate your role‚Äîyou‚Äôll be right at home here. Groupon‚Äôs purpose is to build strong communities through thriving small businesses. To learn more about the world‚Äôs largest local e-commerce marketplace, click here. You can also find out more about us in the latest Groupon news as well as learning about our DEI approach. If all of this sounds like something that‚Äôs a great fit for you, then click apply and join us on a mission to become the ultimate destination for local experiences and services. Beware of Recruitment Fraud: Groupon follows a merit-based recruitment process without charging job seekers any fees. We've noticed an increase in recruitment fraud, including fake job postings and fraudulent interviews and job offers aimed at stealing personal information or money. Be cautious of individuals falsely representing Groupon's Talent Acquisition team with fake job offers. If you encounter any suspicious job offers or interview calls demanding money, recognize these as scams. Groupon is not responsible for losses from such dealings. For legitimate job openings (and a sneak peek into life at Groupon), always check our official career website at Groupon Careers

title: Digital Data Analyst

Extraer y cruzar datos de m√∫ltiples fuentes: Utilizar SQL para extraer y combinar datos de diferentes fuentes (plataformas de marketing, CRM, bases de datos internas, MongoDB) con el fin de construir una visi√≥n integrada y del rendimiento global de marketing. Generar insights que impulsen la toma de decisiones: Identificar tendencias, oportunidades y puntos de mejora. Proporcionar recomendaciones basadas en datos para optimizar el ROI de campa√±as, la adquisici√≥n de usuarios, posicionamiento SEO y la retenci√≥n de usuarios. Colaborar con equipos multidisciplinares: Trabajar estrechamente con los equipos de marketing, producto y data para definir estrategias de medici√≥n, necesidades de datos y asegurar la alineaci√≥n con los KPIs del negocio. Apoyar la automatizaci√≥n de reportes y la calidad del dato: Contribuir a la automatizaci√≥n de informes y dashboards recurrentes. Que necesitamos de ti‚Ä¶ Necesitamos que cuentes con 3-5 a√±os de experiencia en un rol similar Experiencia trabajando con herramientas como: Google Tag Manager (avanzado), Google Analytics 4 (avanzado), Tebleau y Looker Studio (intermedio, SQL (intermedio), Excel y Google Sheets (avanzado). Adem√°s se valora Python , modelos de atribuci√≥n, entornos ecomerce y plataformas de marketing digital. Actitud proactiva, capacidad de organizaci√≥n y orientaci√≥n a resultados, con pasi√≥n por los datos y capacidad para trabajar transversalmente. Residencia en Valencia en una modalidad h√≠brida de teletrabajo. Buen nivel de ingl√©s (B2 m√≠nimo). Valoramos positivamente tener experiencia en entornos SaaS, experiencia en medici√≥n de webs corporativas multi-idioma, como de e-commerce o trabajar en entornos de escalabilidad y tecnol√≥gicos. Qu√© ofrecemos‚Ä¶ Compensaci√≥n salarial competitiva, enfocada en atraer y retener perfiles de alto rendimiento. Bonus anuales para aquellos perfiles que contribuyan de forma sobresaliente en el √©xito de la empresa. Plan de carrera con oportunidades de promoci√≥n y desarrollo continuo. Nos encanta apostar por la gente de casa. Una visi√≥n y un equipo que te inspirar√° a superarte, llev√°ndote al siguiente nivel en tu desarrollo profesional. Formaci√≥n continua. Queremos que siempre est√©s a la vanguardia en tecnolog√≠a y habilidades, por lo que ofrecemos formaciones internas constantes. Ordenador MacBook y pantallas de alta resoluci√≥n para desarrollar tu potencial al m√°ximo. Modalidad h√≠brida (3+2). Tres d√≠as de oficina y dos desde casa si as√≠ te sientes mas productiv@, aunque estamos seguros de que el ambiente y el equipo te har√°n disfrutar de nuestra oficina m√°s de lo esperado. Flexibilidad horaria. Como cada persona rinde mejor a su manera, te damos la libertad de organizar tu tiempo de trabajo entre las 8:00h y las 20:00h, siempre cumpliendo con los compromisos agendados. Nos preocupamos por tu bienestar y ofrecemos cobertura m√©dica para que tengas la tranquilidad que necesitas. Retribuci√≥n flexible opcional. Disfrutar√°s de d√≠as adicionales en fechas especiales como cumplea√±os, navidades o eventos √∫nicos. Sobre Fourvenues... Fourvenues, es la empresa B2B que est√° liderando la transformaci√≥n digital en la industria del ocio nocturno. Y lo mejor, es que no paramos de cerrar nuevos partnerships cada mes, por lo que siempre tenemos desaf√≠os que nos impulsan a esforzarnos al m√°ximo para dar un servicio de diez. Si est√°s en ese momento de tu carrera, en el que est√°s listo para dejar huella, explotando todo tu potencial y ser parte de una empresa en plena expansi√≥n, ¬°este es tu lugar! title: Business Analyst
description: About the job The Apex Group was established in Bermuda in 2003 and is now one of the world‚Äôs largest fund administration and middle office solutions providers. Our business is unique in its ability to reach globally, service locally and provide cross-jurisdictional services. With our clients at the heart of everything we do, our hard-working team has successfully delivered on an unprecedented growth and transformation journey, and we are now represented by over circa 13,000 employees across 112 offices worldwide.Your career with us should reflect your energy and passion. That‚Äôs why, at Apex Group, we will do more than simply ‚Äòempower‚Äô you. We will work to supercharge your unique skills and experience. Take the lead and we‚Äôll give you the support you need to be at the top of your game. And we offer you the freedom to be a positive disrupter and turn big ideas into bold, industry-changing realities. For our business, for clients, and for you Description Their primary responsibilities of the Business Analyst will be working with stakeholders to elicit requirements, analyses and propose IT solutions and deliver functional documentation, design documentation, assisting the development and quality teams during the implementation phases and ensure that the solution delivered matches with requirements. The successful applicant will be able to quickly understand the business strategy and objectives and act as a link between the business stakeholders and developers. It will be necessary to successfully handle multiple tasks, projects and priorities in a fast paced environment. Job specification Define and document business processes and requirements through collaborative stakeholder engagement. This includes working with the business to deliver solutions with a smooth transition through to the production environment. Produce technical (functional and non-functional) documentation as BRD‚Äôs, RFP‚Äôs, DRS‚Äôs and US‚Äôs with acceptance criteria. Ability to clearly communicate ideas to both technical stakeholders and business end users. Interpreting business requirements and translating these into viable solutions with tangible business benefits. Support development and testing during the build and test phases. Identify new opportunities for technology. Skills Required: Experience of 5+ years working as an IT business analyst. Experience in the financial services industry is preferable. Demonstrated ability to work in a changing and challenging environment with a record of producing high quality business analysis documentation. Knowledge of all phases of the development lifecycle. Motivated self-starter who can work in a team environment. 3rd level Qualification (preferably IT related). Experience with UML, BMPN or other modelling notations. Excellent communication, listening and writing skills Excellent stakeholder management skills. Be able to plan and track activities/tasks Ability to work to complete work to schedule Ability to multi-task Background in software development. Experience of implementation and rollout to critical systems. Experience in Agile methodology, preferably Scrum. Experience within SAFe will be considered an asset. Experience with Azure DevOps will be considered an asset. Be willing to travel (limited) if required to support project objectives PBA or CCBA preferable. What you will get in return: A genuinely unique opportunity to be part of an expanding large global business; Competitive remuneration commensurate with skills and experience; Training and development opportunities Additional information: We are an equal opportunity employer and ensure that no applicant is subject to less favourable treatment on the grounds of gender, gender identity, marital status, race, colour, nationality, ethnicity, age, sexual orientation, socio-economic, responsibilities for dependants, physical or mental disability. Any hiring decision are made on the basis of skills, qualifications and experiences. We measure our success as a business, not only by delivering great products and services and continually increasing our assets under administration and market share, but also by how we positively impact people, society and the planet. For more information on our commitment to Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) please visit https://theapexgroup.com/csr-policy/ Disclaimer: Unsolicited CVs sent to Apex (Talent Acquisition Team or Hiring Managers) by recruitment agencies will not be accepted for this position. Apex operates a direct sourcing model and where agency assistance is required, the Talent Acquisition team will engage directly with our exclusive recruitment partners.
