title: Product Analyst - Integrations Team
description: About the job Remote, LATAM , Full Time, Individual Contributor, +2 years of experience Who We Are At Yuno, we are building the payment infrastructure that enables all companies to participate in the global market. Founded by a team of seasoned experts in the payments and IT industries, Yuno provides a high-performance payment orchestrator. Our technology offers companies access to leading payment capabilities, allowing them to engage customers confidently and maintain global business operations with seamless payment integrations worldwide. Shape your future with Yuno! As Product Analyst ambitious and passionate about innovation, joining Yuno will allow you to transform your passion into real high-impact solutions. At Yuno, every role impacts the payment revolution. As a Product Analyst at Yuno, you‚Äôll take ownership of shaping and optimizing our Integrations processes, ensuring. You‚Äôll partner closely with engineering, solution architecture, and product leadership to define integration strategies, uncover new opportunities, and ensure technical solutions meet both immediate and long-term business needs. Beyond gathering insights, you‚Äôll play a key role in setting priorities and driving initiatives that make our integration capabilities more scalable, reliable, and impactful for our customers. üü£ Your challenge at Yuno Engage in discovery with Yuno‚Äôs global network of payment partners, facilitating meetings, understanding documentation and representing Yuno Analyze connectivity options with payment partners and identify the most appropriate integration options and strategies to meet the needs of Yuno merchants Maintain up-to-date feature availability documentation for the partners and APIs that you own Work with engineering colleagues to deliver exceptional, high quality solutions from inception to roll-out Monitor the performance of launched connections and features and provide recommendations for iterative improvements based on data analysis Develop and maintain comprehensive product metrics, dashboards, and reporting to track key performance indicators (KPIs) üü£ Skills you need Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (Computer Science, Business, Economics, Mathematics, or a related discipline) 1 or more years proven experience in a Product or similar role, preferably in the payments industry or related financial services Strong analytical skills with the ability to derive actionable insights from data Excellent communication skills, including the ability to present complex api analysis in a clear and understandable manner Experience with Agile development methodologies and working in cross-functional teams is a plus Detail-oriented with a strategic mindset and the ability to think critically and creatively to solve complex problems and drive business growth Fluent English üü£ What we offer at Yuno Competitive Compensation Remote work - You can work from everywhere! Home Office Bonus - We offer a one time allowance to help you create your ideal home office Work equipment Stock options Health Plan wherever you are Flexible Days off Language, Professional and Personal growth courses

title: Junior Project Engineer
description: About the job SEGURA is an industrial group specialised in the design, development and industrialisation of metal parts and components for the automotive industry, mainly through stamping and welding processes. At the moment 1500 employees are part of the group, distributed in the different plants located in: Almussafes (Spain), Vigo (Spain), Szolnok (Hungary), Treuenbrietzen and Eisenach (Germany) in addition to its headquarters in Paterna (Spain). We have a permanent vacancy for a project engineer with knowledge of German at our offices in Paterna. If you are a recent graduate and speak German, this is your opportunity. MISSION To draw up the project planning and control compliance with the same according to quality, cost and deadline criteria set by Management to ensure satisfactory industrialisation (both internally and externally). MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES: Elaborate the project planning identifying the important milestones and objectives of each one of them. To proactively monitor the project by initiating corrective actions (problem solving), as appropriate, throughout the project, for a successful completion of the project. Track the project through each client's tools (APQP, LiOn, BeOn, ITP) and ensure the completion of the associated project documentation in time to meet the client's requirements. Ensure, with the help of the Launch Process Engineer, compliance with the dates agreed with the external customer during the industrialisation phase of each reference (from pre-series to PSW/N1 approval). Provide support to the client in the production plants and development centres of the client from the prototype and pre-series phases until the start of production or when required by the client. To evaluate your application, the following is essential: - Minimum training in Engineering (Bachelor's or Master's degree). - Demonstrable high level of English and German. - Experience in project management in the industry (internships) will be valued. - Willingness to travel. We offer you to join a project in constant growth, with opportunities for professional development, and possibilities to participate in international projects of the Group. Flexible remuneration plan (medical insurance, restaurant ticket and childcare) Working hours from M to F 07.30 to 16.30 with flexible start times, Fridays from 07:30-14:00 Competitive remuneration, negotiable depending on the candidate's profile. If you feel that you are a person with leadership, resolute, creative, and above all you are passionate about what you do, join the team! At Grupo Segura, equal opportunities is one of our values. Our commitment is to hire the best talent regardless of race, religion, gender, age or other abilities and to promote their professional and personal development.

title: Project Manager
description: About the job Please keep in mind this job post defines our ideal candidate. Although you don‚Äôt match all the requirements, don‚Äôt be afraid to apply! ;) Location of this role Spain, UK or Hungary. It‚Äôs a remote-first role with the option to go to one of our super nice offices! What we are looking for? We‚Äôre looking for an experienced Project Manager to execute the global delivery strategy.Your mission will be ensuring the successful and high-quality delivery of technology solutions to our clients exceeding their expectations, by being the glue between our clients and our teams, fostering collaboration, building strong relationships, and nurturing a culture of excellence. What your main functions will look like Your projects could be commercially structured as fixed price, T&M, support, or augmented and you will be in charge of planning, scheduling, budget tracking, budget forecasting, execution and delivery of software and web projects. You will ensure the successful completion as well as overseeing the team working on the projects. In this position, you will play a critical role in the following areas: Collaborate to successfully meet the strategic KPIs and goals set for the Delivery department (e.g. CSAT score, etc.). Manage client needs and expectations, fostering positive relationships, and delivering exceptional client satisfaction. Own the delivery of several engagements, managing scope, schedule, risks, and issues to ensure delivery is aligned with our contractual commitments. Ensure roadmaps are prioritized to guarantee that delivery teams deliver continuous releases and meet established deadlines. Monitor client engagements with appropriate delivery reporting metrics (e.g. health checks, risks log, etc.), taking actions proactively based on this information. Review new contracts or scope of work extensions. Have a constant overview of the budget of the engagements you manage, creating and monitoring billing plans to understand the actual VS planned revenue and take actions proactively as needed. This will also include budget forecasting in relation to the completion of the project, where appropriate. Review and approve the timesheets, to ensure your clients are invoiced accurately by Finance. Manage staffing needs, ensuring early visibility and effective planning for changes on capacity, budget, and opportunities related to the engagements you are managing. Collaborate with presales activities when required (e.g. providing advice, presenting our ways of working and previous experience to a client, etc.) Support the onboarding process of new employees who join the company and the engagement you are managing. Foster the team's motivation and engagement, promoting a culture of empowerment, feedback, and collaboration. Support the mentors, line managers and mentees that are part of the delivery teams you manage, providing guidance and fostering key performance management activities (e.g. 1on1, goals management, etc.). Minimum qualifications At least 5 years of experience in a Project Management role. Strong communication & active listening skills in English. Ability to successfully take both agile and waterfall approaches as needed, depending on the nature of the project and contract. Effective budget, risks, and issues management skills, with a high level of proactivity and adaptability to solve problems and make sound decisions. Orientation to results & client satisfaction, with solid planning & time management abilities that enable proper expectations management and delivering on our word. Ability to foster collaborative environments that empower employees, build strong relationships, encourage candid feedback, and recognize achievements. What One Beyond is committed to providing to you! Attractive benefits package applies

title: Project Manager
description: About the job Project Manager | Full-Time | Remote (EMEA Region) We are a trusted recruitment partner, committed to connecting outstanding professionals with leading global organizations. On behalf of a well-established software holding company, we are seeking a skilled and driven Project Manager to oversee and deliver key initiatives across its diverse portfolio. This is a full-time remote opportunity, open to candidates located within the EMEA region. About the Role As a Project Manager, you will play a central role in leading cross-functional teams, driving execution, and ensuring successful delivery of projects across the company‚Äôs software operations. You will manage project lifecycles end-to-end, from planning and resource allocation to execution, risk management, and stakeholder communication. This role requires a highly organized professional with excellent leadership and problem-solving skills, capable of thriving in a dynamic, fast-paced environment. Key Responsibilities Plan, manage, and oversee software projects from initiation to completion. Define project scope, objectives, deliverables, and timelines in alignment with business goals. Coordinate cross-functional teams to ensure milestones and deadlines are met. Monitor project progress, identify risks, and implement effective mitigation strategies. Manage stakeholder communication, providing regular updates and reports on project status. Ensure adherence to quality standards, compliance, and best practices in project execution. Drive continuous improvement by analyzing project outcomes and implementing lessons learned. Qualifications Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business, or a related field (PMP, PRINCE2, or Agile certification is a plus). 5+ years of experience in project management, preferably within the software or technology sector. Strong knowledge of project management methodologies (Agile, Scrum, or Waterfall). Proven ability to manage budgets, resources, and timelines effectively. Excellent communication, leadership, and interpersonal skills. Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a remote, distributed team environment. Fluency in English is required; additional languages are an advantage. What‚Äôs Offered Full-time remote position open across the EMEA region. Competitive salary package with performance-based incentives. Opportunity to work on diverse projects within a global software holding company. Professional growth and career development pathways. Inclusive, collaborative, and innovative work culture. Apply Now If you are an experienced project leader eager to drive impact within a global software environment, we encourage you to apply today.

title: Project Manager
description: About the job The Project Manager works with our internal team, distributors, contractors, and end clients to ensure the proper execution of installations and commissioning, as well as client training and general troubleshooting both onsite and remotely. Responsibilities: Project Management Manage installations from several weeks before work begins until project completion, acting as the main point of contact with the client/contractor/subcontractor team. Build and maintain relationships with subcontractors, site supervisors, and clients to ensure adherence to installation methodology, commissioning, and training protocols. On-site Technical Support Must be available to travel to project sites across Spain, with occasional travel within Europe. Coordinate subcontractors and Vortex‚Äôs own installation team to ensure equipment is installed according to Vortex's quality standards. Hold site meetings and make on-the-ground decisions with the site supervisor or client. Document installation progress and complete a final report on the technical support provided. Conduct thorough site inspections prior to system activation. Provide comprehensive training to operators on initial system start-up and shutdown procedures. Obtain client sign-off on completed projects. Provide feedback and potential solutions to the product development team regarding recurring issues. Communicate with the remote technical support team to request necessary spare/additional parts. Remote Technical Support (phone, email) ‚Äì when not on-site Respond to and resolve client (distributor, contractor, or end client) inquiries via phone or email. Log calls and reports in the appropriate system. Assess whether an on-site visit is necessary. Follow up with the internal design team and discuss possible solutions. Other Duties Assist in training clients and certified installers, including developing materials, scheduling, and facilitating sessions. Participate in continuous improvement of internal processes. Help create user guides and maintenance manuals. Requirements: Willingness to travel throughout Spain and occasionally within Europe. Degree in Mechanical Engineering. Solid general knowledge of construction, with a focus on plumbing, civil works, and electrical systems. Ability to read and produce technical drawings (AutoCAD). Ability to interact with contractors and clients. Ability to train others on technical matters. Strong communication skills and problem-solving skills. Project management skills. Strong time management and prioritization abilities. Ability to work across different business cultures. Well-developed interpersonal skills. Positive, team-oriented attitude. Computer literacy. Safety-oriented. Fluent in spoken and written English (mandatory).

title: Project Manager (Remote - EMEA)
description: About the job This position is posted by Jobgether on behalf of Spiralyze. We are currently looking for a Project Manager in EMEA. This is a fully remote opportunity to lead fast-paced, impactful projects in the digital space. As a Project Manager, you'll act as the driving force behind A/B testing initiatives, coordinating cross-functional teams and shaping long-term testing strategies. With access to high-profile clients and global collaboration, you'll play a central role in accelerating performance, innovation, and results. If you're passionate about data-driven decision-making and enjoy being the hub of action, this is the role for you. üîπ Accountabilities: Lead and coordinate multidisciplinary teams (researchers, designers, copywriters, developers, QA, analysts, and clients) to execute A/B testing projects efficiently Build strategic testing roadmaps (10-20 test plans ahead), aligning client needs with business goals Act as the primary contact for clients and internal teams, providing proactive updates, motivation, and momentum Organize and run weekly client meetings, ensuring projects are on track and aligned with client expectations Maintain exceptional organizational workflows to manage timelines, tasks, and deliverables Requirements Proven experience in project management, ideally in a software or digital agency environment Outstanding organizational and planning skills; you thrive on structure and clear processes Excellent communication abilities ‚Äî you proactively engage clients and ensure clarity across all stakeholders Strong curiosity about technology, digital performance, and user behavior A positive, energetic attitude that rallies teams and keeps momentum high No prior A/B testing experience required ‚Äî full training provided Benefits Career growth: Fast-track promotion opportunities for high performers, regardless of location Tech stipend: Support for computer or software purchases Education allowance: Company-paid courses and training to advance your skills Time off: 20 paid vacation days per year, plus local holidays Fully remote: Work from anywhere in the EMEA region üß† Jobgether Hiring Process Jobgether is a Talent Matching Platform that connects companies with the right candidates using AI-driven job matching. When you apply, your profile is evaluated through our AI-powered screening process designed to identify top talent fairly and efficiently. üîç Our AI carefully analyzes your CV and LinkedIn profile, evaluating your skills, experience, and achievements. üìä It compares your profile to the job's key requirements and success factors to generate a match score. üéØ The top 3 candidates with the highest match scores are automatically shortlisted. üß† When needed, our human team conducts an additional review to ensure no strong profile is missed. The process is transparent, skills-based, and free of bias, focusing solely on your fit for the role. Once the shortlist is finalized, it is shared directly with the hiring company, which handles the interviews and next steps. Thank you for your interest!

title: Quality Analyst (Sales) - Spanish
description: About the job About Revolut People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, and more freedom. Since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. Our powerhouse of products ‚Äî including spending, saving, investing, exchanging, travelling, and more ‚Äî help our 60+ million customers get more from their money every day. As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‚Äå 2 things are essential to our success: our people and our culture. In recognition of our outstanding employee experience, we've been certified as a Great Place to Work‚Ñ¢. So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our offices and remotely, to help us achieve our mission. And we're looking for more brilliant people. People who love building great products, redefining success, and turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution. About The Role Our Sales team powers customer growth around the world. From prospecting to acquisition and activation, they own their market segments, solve complex problems, and help more customers discover the value of Revolut with a sharp, solution-oriented approach. We're looking for a Quality Analyst to work closely across our sales teams, supporting Account Executives and their managers. You'll use a detail-oriented approach to improve our processes and deliver the best possible results. Up for the challenge? Let‚Äôs get in touch. What You'll Be Doing Monitoring the quality and compliance of all sales interactions, including reviewing and scoring phone calls, emails, and related chats Providing feedback to agents based on their quality score and results Working with sales trainers to produce best-practice guides and facilitate regular training What You'll Need 6+ months of experience as a Quality Analyst or similar role Fluency in English and Spanish Great quality score results Proven diligence and a high standard of integrity Excellent interpersonal skills Nice to have Experience in a sales environment Building a global financial super app isn‚Äôt enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that‚Äôs why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We‚Äôre doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That‚Äôs why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team. Important notice for candidates: Job scams are on the rise. Please keep these guidelines in mind when applying for any open roles. Only apply through official Revolut channels. We don‚Äôt use any third-party services or platforms for our recruitment. Always double-check the emails you receive. Make sure all communications are being done through official Revolut emails, with an @revolut.com domain. We won't ask for payment or personal financial information during the hiring process. If anyone does ask you for this, it‚Äôs a scam. Report it immediately. By submitting this application, I confirm that all the information given by me in this application for employment and any additional documents attached hereto are true to the best of my knowledge and that I have not wilfully suppressed any material fact. I confirm I have disclosed if applicable any previous employment with Revolut. I accept that if any of the information given by me in this application is in any way false or incorrect, my application may be rejected, any offer of employment may be withdrawn or my employment with Revolut may be terminated summarily or I may be dismissed. By submitting this application, I agree that my personal data will be processed in accordance with Revolut's <a class="postings-link" href="https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates">Candidate Privacy Notice

title: Analyst, Strategic Asset Management (Global 1099)
description: About the job Who We Are AvantStay delivers world class, authentic, tech-enabled short-term rental ("STR") group experiences targeted at the millennial generation. We are venture funded and growing rapidly in the explosive $100+ billion dollar STR industry. We deliver a customized end-to-end experience that is tailored just for groups and powered with technology at every layer. What We Are Looking For An Analyst, Strategic Asset Management who will lead high-impact reporting, drive operational improvements, and support strategic decision-making for our most important partnerships. This role requires advanced Excel proficiency, strong Tableau expertise (including building and evolving dashboards and reports), exceptional project management skills, and the confidence to engage with high-priority homeowners, realtors, and external stakeholders. What You'll Do Support Strategic Initiatives: Support the Associate Director, Strategic Asset Management to manage analysis, reporting, and ad hoc projects for high-priority partnerships Drive Tableau Reporting Excellence: Build, enhance, and maintain Tableau dashboards and reports; identify opportunities for new reporting solutions; and lead change initiatives to improve visualization, accessibility, and insight delivery Enhance Financial Insights: Analyze results, monitor variances, identify trends, and recommend actionable strategies to management Manage Property Performance: Oversee daily analysis of property-level financial performance, identifying opportunities and risks across key metrics Build and Maintain Models: Develop and maintain financial models to track and forecast property revenue, occupancy, expenses, and NOI Project Management & Stakeholder Coordination: Manage cross-functional projects from start to finish, including realtor and homeowner communications, creation of owner decks, coordination of financial reviews, and weekly performance reporting Collaborate Cross-Functionally: Partner with internal teams to optimize portfolio performance and deliver actionable insights Prepare and Present Reports: Deliver clear, data-driven reporting to internal stakeholders, property owners, and executive leadership Engage with Homeowners & Realtors: Lead conversations with a solutions-oriented approach, offering strategic recommendations backed by solid analysis Refine Processes: Continuously improve tools, workflows, and reporting to enhance operational efficiency and accuracy Requirements What you'll bring Experience: 2-5 years in finance, consulting, asset management, or a related field; experience in real estate, hospitality, or related industries is a plus Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in a related field Business Acumen: Strategic thinker who can evaluate multiple scenarios, anticipate outcomes, and guide decisions beyond the numbers Initiative: Self-starter with a bias for action, capable of driving enterprise-level reporting and operational improvements Analytical Excellence: Advanced Excel skills and strong Tableau expertise, with proven ability to build, adapt, and optimize reporting solutions Project Management Skills: Skilled in managing complex projects involving multiple stakeholders and diverse deliverables (financials, decks, communications, data reports) Communication & Influence: Excellent communicator with proven ability to build trusted relationships and influence decisions across stakeholder groups Systems Savvy: Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and Tableau; experience with other data visualization tools is a plus Benefits Competitive pay Fully remote - work from anywhere No soliciting from staffing agencies. Thank you!

title: Assistant Project Manager (Work From Home)
description: About the job Persona is the company top startups use to hire people from all around the world. Our vision is a future where each person can find the best role for them and companies can discover the world‚Äôs best talent. Founded by two Stanford University graduates, Persona works with the world‚Äôs fastest-growing technology startups. Our clients are funded by some of the world‚Äôs top investors, like Founders Fund, Sequoia Capital, and Andreessen Horowitz. Persona is a talent agency that recruits, trains, and staffs talented remote professionals such as yourself. This is an opportunity to work closely with the future Googles, Facebooks, and Amazons of the world‚Äîbuilding out their organizations and helping them reach the next level of success. We support everyone we hire with training, mentoring, and technology resources so they are enabled to do their best and are as happy as possible in their roles. We have a large international team dedicated to supporting and taking care of new Persona team members, and our goal is to provide excellent long-term career opportunities for everyone who joins the team. Who‚Äôs building Persona? We are a global team of passionate problem solvers who love to build new things and make our customers happy. Our team is made up of motivated, hard-working people spanning the globe, united by a culture of learning and continuous improvement. What we‚Äôre looking for: We are looking for Assistant Project Managers to help our clients operate and scale different parts of their growing businesses. As an Assistant Project Manager you'll be a general problem solver, collaborating with different teams at our client company and helping them with various projects. Responsibilities‚Äîwhat you'll do: Business-to-Business Communication Client and Vendor Management Data Collection and Analysis Reports Generation and Documentation Project Management Tools Process Optimization Requirements: Fully fluent in English Skilled in the use of apps and technology Ability to commit long-term and full-time Ability to work U.S. business hours (Pacific Time, Central Time, or Eastern Time) No work experience is required, but we will take any work experience you have into account This position is for serious, career-oriented candidates Other qualities we look for: Track record of success at work or in school An ability to solve complex problems with minimal guidance Experience in high performance work or school environments Skilled at anticipating team members‚Äô needs Willingness to work hard and persevere Intellectual curiosity and resourcefulness Professionalism What we offer: Best salaries in the industry Permanent ability to work from anywhere in the world Opportunities for growth and advancement A fast-paced and collaborative environment Warm and friendly company culture Full benefits Benefits at Persona: Health insurance Unlimited paid time off (paid sick and vacation leaves) Annual bonuses based on performance Monthly tech allowance Opportunity to be paid in your currency of choice Others depending on seniority This is a full-time and long-term role, dedicated exclusively to serving one of our clients. We are looking for individuals who are ready to fully commit their time and energy to one company and grow and develop along with that company. All roles at Persona are 100% work-from-anywhere (work from home or wherever it suits you best). If this is your first time working for a U.S. company, that‚Äôs okay; we provide guidance and assistance getting set up as a remote professional. Once hired, we will carefully match you to a client company of ours that perfectly suits your career background, skills, and goals. In case you or any exceptional people you know are exploring other roles, our rapidly growing company is also looking for new team members with backgrounds in administration, bookkeeping, accounting, finance, project management, operations, recruiting, human resources, content writing, social media management, research, executive assistance, customer service, customer support, technical support, data management, video editing, sales, account management, marketing, and design. Visit our website for more information: https://www.personatalent.com/

title: Project Manager

title: Project Manager, Player Care- Monopoly Go!
description: About the job Scopely is looking for a Project Manager in Customer Support to join our Monopoly GO! Game team in one of our global studio hubs or remotely. At Scopely, we care deeply about what we do and want to inspire play every day - whether in our work environments alongside our talented colleagues or through our deep connections with our communities of players. We are a global team of game lovers who are developing, publishing and innovating the mobile games industry, connecting millions of people around the world daily. Monopoly GO! is our new casual game and a key franchise that has just become Scopely‚Äôs largest game, enjoyed by millions of players. The team is based in Europe and the US, and works every day to create captivating new experiences for our players. What You Will Do As Project Manager, you will work alongside a team responsible for driving excellence in delivering product insights, running outsourced support operations and designing state-of-the-art technology to support our players. Responsibilities include: Utilise project management skills to oversee game-related development projects. Monitor and report on project metrics and KPIs to ensure deliverables meet the highest quality standards Work in close partnership with Product and Technology stakeholders, ensuring clear communication and effective management of timelines and deliverables. Lead war room management during critical project phases Manage relationships with external vendors, including handling day-to-day operational processes Partner with cross-functional teams to provide insights leading to direct improvements of player experience in the game Develop and manage a comprehensive knowledge base and ensure training processes are up to date What We‚Äôre Looking For 3+ years of project management experience in the video game or tech industry Proven track record of successfully managing projects from inception to completion based on business case and expected impact. Great communication skills within multicultural, pluridisciplinary teams Experience with data and BI presentation tools (Looker, Tableau, ‚Ä¶) A passion for making players enjoy world-class mobile, social and casual games. At Scopely, we create games for everyone - and want to ensure that the people behind our games reflect that! We are committed to creating a diverse, supportive work environment where everyone is treated with respect. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities and welcome individuals from all backgrounds to join us & embrace the adventure! About Us Scopely is a global interactive entertainment and mobile-first video game company, home to many top, award-winning experiences such as "MONOPOLY GO!," ‚ÄúStar Trek‚Ñ¢ Fleet Command,‚Äù ‚ÄúStumble Guys,‚Äù ‚ÄúMARVEL Strike Force,‚Äù and ‚ÄúYahtzee¬Æ With Buddies,‚Äù among others. Scopely creates, publishes, and live-operates immersive games that empower a directed-by-consumer‚Ñ¢ experience across multiple platforms--from mobile, web, PC and beyond. Founded in 2011, Scopely is fueled by a world-class team and a proprietary technology platform Playgami that supports one of the most diversified portfolios in the games industry. Recognized multiple times as one of Fast Company‚Äôs ‚ÄúWorld‚Äôs Most Innovative Companies,‚Äù Scopely is a multi-billion-dollar business due to its ability to create long-lasting game experiences that players enjoy for years. Scopely has global operations in more than a dozen markets across Asia, EMEA, and North America, and is home to many internal game development teams, referred to as Scopely Studios, with additional game studio partners across four continents. Scopely was acquired by Savvy Games Group in July 2023 for $4.9 billion, and is now an independent subsidiary of Savvy. For more information on Scopely, visit: scopely.com Notice to candidates: Scopely, Inc and its affiliates will never request payment or ask for financial information as a condition for applying to a position or receiving an offer of employment. All official Scopely, Inc. recruiters only use email domains that end with @scopely.com. Our official website is www.scopely.com. Please only apply to positions posted on our official website and ensure the recruiter only communicates via the official email domain. Should you have any questions or encounter any fraudulent requests/emails/websites, please immediately contact recruiting@scopely.com. Our job applicant privacy policies are available here: California Privacy Notice and EEA/UK Privacy Notice. Employment at Scopely is based solely on a person's merit and qualifications. Scopely does not discriminate against any employee or applicant because of race, creed, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin, disability, age, genetic information, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy or related condition (including breastfeeding), or any other basis protected by law. We also consider qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.

title: Junior Compliance Analyst
description: About the job üöÄ Join Us in Protecting the Future of Web3 At Dapper Labs, we‚Äôre building the future of digital ownership by making Web3 accessible and empowering users to engage with blockchain technology in safe, meaningful, and enjoyable ways. Whether it‚Äôs NFTs or fintech, creators or collectors, we‚Äôre shaping the next generation of digital experiences. We‚Äôre looking for a Junior Compliance Analyst to join our Risk Operations team and help us protect our community from financial crime, detect suspicious activity, and respond to blockchain-based threats. This role requires weekend availability and hands-on experience with Chainalysis, identity verification platforms, and SQL. üîç What You‚Äôll Do Monitor transactions and activity using Chainalysis to detect and escalate suspicious activity in real time. Conduct thorough investigations of account activities as a result of transaction monitoring alerts Facilitate Request for Information (RFI) in the investigation of transaction monitoring cases Review and validate identity documentation using Persona, Sardine, and similar platforms. Investigate potentially fraudulent or high-risk users by analyzing behavioral patterns, wallet activity, and verification inconsistencies. Use SQL to extract and analyze user and transaction data to support investigations and compliance reporting. Conduct enhanced due diligence (EDD) reviews for high-risk users and escalate findings as needed. Collaborate with internal teams (Fraud, Payments, Engineering) to implement improvements in compliance workflows and alert handling. Maintain detailed supporting information used during investigation and audit logs to ensure regulatory readiness. üíº What You Bring 2+ years of experience in a compliance, fraud, trust & safety, or risk operations role, ideally in fintech, crypto, or Web3. Prior experience in case management tools, alert queue systems, or crypto exchange environments. Hands-on experience with Chainalysis or other blockchain analytics tools. Proficiency in SQL‚Äîyou‚Äôre comfortable writing queries and digging into raw data. Familiarity with ID verification platforms like Persona, Sardine, or similar. Strong attention to detail and analytical thinking with the ability to recognize patterns and anomalies. Comfort with working independently on weekends and managing time-sensitive case escalations. Excellent written communication skills, especially for investigative summaries and internal documentation. Understanding of blockchain fundamentals, NFT ecosystems, and digital wallets. Knowledge of BSA/AML, OFAC, and global KYC/EDD regulatory requirements is a strong plus. A strong team player who is also able to work independently with minimal oversight. ‚ú® Nice to Haves Experience with manual process automation; specifically AI Agents Experience working with ticketing systems such as Zendesk, Freshdesk, or other case management tools. Why You‚Äôll Love Working Here üåç Remote-first culture with flexible hours and a global team. üöÄ Work on the cutting edge of Web3, NFTs, and fintech. üß† Learn fast with direct exposure to real fraud cases and rapid decision-making. üí° Be part of a mission-driven company building the trusted foundation for decentralized experiences.

title: Technical Project Manager / Delivery Manager (Fully Remote)
description: About the job We‚Äôre a small but fast-growing Web3 development agency (14 people right now) and we‚Äôre looking for someone who‚Äôs sharp, organized, ambitious, and client-focused to join us as our Technical Project Manager / Delivery Manager. This is not a corporate environment ‚Äî we‚Äôre young, flexible, and fast-paced. Most of our team is based in Western Europe, fully remote. As long as you‚Äôre getting things done, you can set up your day however you like (we just ask for 8 working hours between 9am‚Äì9pm CEST). What the Role Looks Like This role is a mix between project manager and delivery manager. You‚Äôll be making sure projects run smoothly end-to-end: communication, timelines, onboarding, launches, and client experience. We want someone who‚Äôs not just ‚Äútracking tasks‚Äù but really owning delivery and making both clients and devs feel supported. Communication & Updates ‚Üí Clear, structured updates so clients never chase you. ‚Üí Proactive about risks, timelines, and next steps. ‚Üí Professional but approachable tone at all times. Project Management & Process ‚Üí Create clear roadmaps and milestones. ‚Üí Keep scope and deliverables under control. ‚Üí Spot risks/dependencies before they cause problems. ‚Üí Keep tickets/issues organized (Notion, Slack). Onboarding & Kickoff ‚Üí Onboard clients with welcome pack, kickoff call, tool setup (Slack/Telegram, repos, boards). ‚Üí Align goals, scope, and success metrics early. ‚Üí Make sure we get them early wins in the first 1‚Äì2 weeks. Deployment & Launch ‚Üí Manage final launch flows. ‚Üí Use proper launch checklists (performance, SEO, security, mobile responsiveness). ‚Üí Support clients with training, handover docs, Looms. ‚Üí Run smooth launches with clear communication and a fallback plan. Client Experience ‚Üí Explain decisions in a way that builds confidence. ‚Üí Reduce stress during crunch moments. ‚Üí Celebrate milestones and keep relationships strong post-delivery. Proactivity ‚Üí Spot potential opportunities with clients (upsells, connections, etc.) ‚Üí Bring new ideas, industry best practices, and a partner mindset. What We‚Äôre Looking For Agency experience ‚Üí you‚Äôve worked at a software/dev agency before. Technical fluency ‚Üí you don‚Äôt need to code daily, but you should understand how full-stack JS apps (frontend + backend) are built. Notion skills ‚Üí we use it heavily for project coordination, so you should be comfortable. Languages ‚Üí strong English (written & spoken). Spanish is a big plus. People skills ‚Üí this role is about trust and communication. You should be clear, empathetic, and able to keep clients calm and confident. Proactive ‚Üí ****Self-motivated, proactive problem-solver, and dedicated to delivering high-quality work. Strives for perfection in their craft and displays genuine care for the projects and potential challenges that may arise with clients. What You‚Äôll Get Full remote flexibility, with a team spread across Europe. A young, ambitious team (we move fast, no bureaucracy). A role that actually grows with you ‚Äî we‚Äôre scaling and you‚Äôll have space to step up. The chance to directly shape how we deliver projects and work with clients. Salary range: $2,000-$3,000 depending on experience

title: Ecommerce Data Analyst
description: About the job Tired of inheriting someone else‚Äôs messy dashboards? Ready to build the entire BI function from the ground up - your way? We‚Äôre looking for a hands-on Ecommerce Data Analyst to help a fast-scaling DTC team stop guessing and start acting on real data. This is a unique opportunity to architect a clean, scalable data infrastructure from scratch, enabling data-driven decisions across marketing, ops, product, and leadership. If you love collecting, cleaning, and connecting data - and transforming that into insights that actually drive action - this is your chance to make a massive impact in a company that‚Äôs hungry for your expertise. YOUR MISSION To build and own a brand-new Business Intelligence system, structuring raw, fragmented data from multiple sources into accessible dashboards and reports that empower the teams to optimize performance, identify inefficiencies, and make smarter decisions. This is a full-time, contractor role. WHAT‚ÄôS IN IT FOR YOU Architect the company‚Äôs entire BI stack and define best practices from day one Work with high-leverage datasets from platforms like Shopify, Meta Ads, GA, TripleWhale, Klaviyo, Checkout champ, Phone Apps, and more Operate independently in a low-data-maturity environment where your work will directly drive growth Work from anywhere with a fully international and global team WHAT YOU‚ÄôLL BE DOING Build a brand-new Business Intelligence infrastructure from scratch Collect and connect data from multiple marketing and analytics platforms to create a unified view of performance Work with large datasets and create custom AI bots Build and maintain automated processes that transform raw data into structured, usable insights Design intuitive dashboards and reports that help the team make fast, informed decisions Turn complex data into clear, actionable insights that drive marketing strategy and funnel performance Spot anomalies or underperformance early and flag them to key stakeholders Work cross-functionally with teams across marketing, tech, and leadership to improve data visibility and measurement WHO YOU ARE Experience: 3+ years in ecommerce data analysis, business intelligence, or analytics roles with exposure to data infrastructure and performance reporting Builder Mentality: You‚Äôve worked in (or thrive in) low-data-maturity environments and know how to get results without perfect tools Technical Skills: Proficient in SQL and comfortable working with Python or similar scripting tools to automate and structure data Platform Familiarity: Experienced with key marketing data sources like Shopify, GA, Facebook Ads, and email platforms Analytical & Strategic: You connect the dots across funnel stages, ROI metrics, and ad performance to guide decision-making Self-Starter: Comfortable working independently and building systems from the ground up in a fast-paced environment Collaborative Partner: Skilled at working across departments and aligning data initiatives with company objectives Software Background: Bonus if you have a foundation in software engineering to collaborate more effectively with developers RECRUITMENT PROCESS Intro Chat: A quick intro call to understand your experience and motivations Tech Interview: Deep dive into your technical abilities and past experience Task: A small, real-world BI task to see how you think and communicate Final Chat: We‚Äôll align expectations, goals, and finalize the next steps

title: Creative Project Manager
description: About the job As a Creative Project Manager at Designity, you‚Äôll be the driving force behind high-impact creative projects‚Äîfrom branding and digital campaigns to web builds and content production. You‚Äôll connect the dots between client goals and creative execution, leading cross-functional teams with precision, speed, and a sharp eye for creative quality. You‚Äôll also leverage AI-powered tools to streamline workflows, eliminate bottlenecks, and keep projects moving faster‚Äîso your team can stay focused on what matters most: delivering bold, effective creative work. ‚Äç Designity is a Creative-as-a-Service (CaaS) platform that empowers businesses with a flexible, high-quality, and scalable alternative to traditional agencies and in-house teams. ‚Äç Our unique model connects marketing and creative leaders with the top 3% of US-based creative and marketing talent, all led by experienced Creative Directors, Project Managers, and Marketing Strategists. Through our collaborative platform, we streamline the creative process, ensuring fast, high-impact execution without the inefficiencies of hiring in-house or the high costs of traditional agencies. ‚Äç Brands like Calendly, Kung Fu Tea, and Marriott Hotels trust Designity to handle their design and marketing needs, proving that there's a better way to scale creativity. Unlike in-house hiring, which is expensive and skill-limiting, or marketplaces like Upwork and Fiverr, which lack reliability and creative oversight, Designity delivers a seamless, results-driven approach that makes creative collaboration effortless. ‚Äç PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES: Lead end-to-end creative projects across branding, campaigns, websites, and digital content‚Äîfrom kickoff through delivery. Collaborate with Creative Directors to turn client goals into clear briefs, timelines, and actionable creative strategies. Manage scope, schedules, and resources across multiple projects to ensure on-time, high-quality execution. Own client communications‚Äîsetting expectations, sharing updates, leading reviews, and resolving issues with clarity and confidence. Guide creative teams through each phase of work, ensuring alignment, brand consistency, and strategic impact. Evaluate in-progress creative against project goals, providing structure and feedback that drives executional quality. Leverage AI tools and automation to streamline task management, optimize workflows, and speed up delivery. Monitor project performance, identify risks early, and make real-time adjustments to keep work on track. Improve processes continuously‚Äîidentifying gaps in delivery, communication, or structure and implementing smarter solutions. REQUIREMENTS: 5+ years of experience managing creative projects, campaigns, or brand initiatives in an agency or similar creative environment. Strong understanding of end-to-end creative workflows across branding, digital design, marketing, and content. Proven ability to lead cross-functional creative teams, evaluate work, and ensure alignment with brand and business goals. Demonstrated success managing multiple fast-paced projects with shifting priorities and tight timelines. Experience working directly with clients‚Äîowning communication, presenting creative, and navigating feedback cycles. Hands-on experience with project management and collaboration tools, or equivalent platforms. Strong track record of applying AI or automation to improve project operations, team efficiency, or creative output. Excellent organizational and communication skills with a high degree of accountability. Comfortable working independently in a fully remote environment. Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Marketing, Communications, Design, or a related field is a plus. ‚Äç BENEFITS: Join a company at the perfect moment! Career making opportunity. Work remotely full-time, within a virtual office environment. Unwind during the flexible PTO (available after 90 days), and company holidays. Professional growth opportunities and ongoing training. Enjoy dedicated focus times designed to boost your productivity and creativity. Fast-moving, values-driven, globally distributed team. In order to be considered for this position, you need to complete the application process at www.designity.com/careers/creative-project-manager ‚Äç Please do NOT follow up on your application. We will be in touch within 2-3 weeks if you're qualified. ‚Äç At Designity, employment decisions are based on business needs, qualifications, and merit. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer, valuing diversity in culture, perspectives, skills, and experiences, which strengthens our team, clients, and products. Be cautious when applying. Official communications from Designity will come only from the Designity.com domain. We will never request payment details. Beware of scammers using fake domains like Designity.team to attempt fraud.

title: Junior Talent Coordinator (Remote within Spain)
description: About the job At Leadtech, we've been redefining digital businesses since 2009, creating innovative online solutions that reach millions of users every month. With a diverse team of over 700 members from 23+ nationalities, we're united by a passion for creativity and collaboration. We specialize in delivering user-centric experiences across web and mobile platforms, where people can connect with our products like never before. We're proud of our global reach and committed to fostering an inclusive workplace where every individual contributes to our shared vision of bringing cutting-edge projects to life. Learn more about our journey and mission on our About Us page! About The Role Leadtech is growing, and we're looking for a Talent Coordinator to help us streamline and enhance our hiring processes. As we expand, ensuring a smooth and efficient candidate experience is crucial to attracting top talent. We need someone organized, proactive, and passionate about supporting recruitment operations. Do you have experience coordinating hiring processes in the digital industry? If you thrive in a fast-paced environment and enjoy working closely with recruiters and hiring managers, we'd love to hear from you! YOUR MISSION As a Talent Coordinator at Leadtech, you will: Organize and manage interview schedules for candidates, ensuring timely communication and smooth logistics between candidates and interviewers Keep candidates informed throughout the recruitment process, providing timely updates on next steps and interview feedback Maintain and update candidate information in the Applicant Tracking System (ATS), ensuring that all records are accurate and up to date Assist in managing internal recruitment processes by supporting the administrative management of applications and maintaining continuous communication with employees interested in the processes, helping to ensure fluidity and satisfaction Assist in the preparation of job offers, ensuring all relevant documents are accurate and completed in a timely manner Support the collection and organization of required documentation from candidates, including references, identification, and other necessary paperwork Coordinate with the Payroll team to ensure that new hires are properly onboarded and all payroll-related tasks are completed Act as a point of contact with recruitment vendors, external agencies, and partner companies supporting the recruitment process. Ensure smooth communication and alignment with external partners to enhance recruitment efforts Requirements WHAT WILL MAKE YOU STAND OUT FROM THE CROWD We're looking for someone with a balance of hard and soft skills who can thrive in a dynamic, cross-functional environment. Here's what we'd love to see: Previous experience in a Talent Coordinator, HR Assistant, or similar administrative role Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple tasks and priorities Excellent written and verbal communication skills with attention to detail Familiarity with Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS) and HR software Ability to work collaboratively in a team-oriented environment Proficiency in office software (e.g., Microsoft Office, Google Suite) and other communication tools Strong problem-solving skills and ability to adapt in a fast-paced environment Experience in managing relationships with external vendors and recruitment agencies is a plus Strong attention to detail Proficiency in English Benefits WHY SHOULD YOU JOIN US? Growth and career development At Leadtech, we prioritize your growth. Enjoy a flexible career path with personalized internal training and an annual budget for external learning opportunities Work-Life balance Benefit from a flexible schedule with flextime (7 - 9:30 a.m. start, 3:30 - 6 p.m. end) and the option of working full remote or from our Barcelona office. Enjoy free Friday afternoons with a 7-hour workday, plus a 35-hour workweek in July and August so you can savor summer! Comprehensive benefits Competitive salary, full-time permanent contract, and top-tier private health insurance (including dental and psychological services) 25 days of vacation plus your birthday off, with flexible vacation options‚Äîno blackout days! Unique Perks If you wish to come, in our office in Barcelona you'll find it coplete with free coffee, fresh fruit, snacks, a game room, and a rooftop terrace with stunning Mediterranean views Additional benefits include ticket restaurant and nursery vouchers, paid directly from your gross salary Join us in an environment where you're free to innovate, learn, and grow alongside passionate professionals. At Leadtech, you'll tackle exciting challenges and be part of a vibrant team dedicated to delivering exceptional user experiences Equal Employment Opportunity Employer: Leadtech is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer, which means we encourage applications from people with different backgrounds, interests, and personal circumstances. Our team welcomes applicants regardless of their race, gender, age, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, and/or disabilities. All we need is your high energy, skills, and willingness to be a part of a great project! Location You'll have the flexibility to choose whether you'd like to come to the office every day, from time to time, or work fully remote. We want you to find the best combination for you. If you prefer to be surrounded with amazing people, our exceptional office is in Barcelona's Blue Building, located right on the city's seafront. Besides our stunning views, you'll enjoy our office perks such as free fruit, snacks, and coffee and you'll also be able to take part in our Mario Kart and table tennis competitions. The personal data you provide will be processed in order to manage your candidacy for the corporate selection processes that fit your profile. If you wish, you can exercise your rights of access, rectification or cancellation by writing to our address (Avenida Litoral, 12-14, 5ta planta. Barcelona. 08005) or to the email address protecciondedatos@LeadTech.com, attaching to your request a document that can validate your identity. Leadtech is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer, which means we encourage applications from people with different backgrounds, interests, and personal circumstances. Our team welcomes applicants regardless of their race, gender, age, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expressi√≥n and/or disabilities. All we need is your high energy, skills, and willingness to be a part of a great project!

title: Project Manager (Construction, Renewable Energy)
description: About the job We are looking for a project manager based in Spain for management construction of our renewable energy projects across Europe. This position is part of company acting as IPP (independent power producer). Ability to work either as a direct hire or as a freelancer (invoice-based), depending on candidate preference. Personal skills: Excellent communication and interpersonal skills Excellent self-management skills, task prioritization and multiple interface management in parallel Strong organizational skills and attention to detail. Ability to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines. Flexibility and adaptability for changes, priorities, and conditions Strong self-education skills Strong problem-solving abilities and Strategic proactive approach Technical orientation with outstanding ability to look at the bigger picture Technical proficiency and the ability to understand and oversee complex engineering and construction processes.
